Speaker: DRYAD
Text: I can't wait.

Speaker: DRYAD
Text: I did say he was a necromancer, didn't I? As I understand it, Lavok felt that tampering with the veil that separates life from death was his prerogative.

Speaker: DRYAD
Text: The old family was, yes. They continued to practice Lavok's magics long after he left, but my particular branch was not interested in such pursuits.

Speaker: DRYAD
Text: They left in disgust, watching from afar as the old family crumbled over the years. And then my family inherited what little of Lavok's fortune was left.

Speaker: DRYAD
Text: Before you know it, you've spent your life in the library, having never seen the light of day, never truly lived. Believe me, I know this only too well.

Speaker: DRYAD
Text: Nalia, dearie, you remind me so much of Cletus Bifflelips, my second cousin, thrice removed.

Speaker: DRYAD
Text: You wouldn't think so, yet here we are. You see, Cletus had a propensity for bouts of violent projectile vomiting. We'd call him, Cletus the Room Clearer Bifflelips.

Speaker: DRYAD
Text: Now just bear with me for a moment, Nalia. You see, it was after one such bout that Cletus, feeling quite ill, took a painful stroll down to the local witch-woman, in the vague hope that she might have a cure for his problem.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Quickly! We must get out of here before whoever did this returns. I swear, traveling with you is never dull.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No, we have traveled together too long for such games, and I will answer plain and true if it will help.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I will detail our relationship if you wish, but it shall be nothing you do not already know.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Have you forgotten what we have done? Perhaps your senses are addled. I will remind you, but it will not give any new clues as to why we are here.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I will recount what led to this if you wish, though I think I have little to offer that you do not know already.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I will repeat what I believe led to our capture if I must, but I doubt it shall prove to be different than what is already known by you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: At the behest of your slain foster father, my husband Khalid and I have kept an interest in you, though you have proven to be your own person in all things.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Your... unique heritage has proven a magnet to adventure, for better or worse, and your foster father was right in directing us to watch over you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Once we know, we will deal with them in due course, but for the time being, it is more important we retrieve our friends and companions and leave this place.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You, however, look as though you have been treated most unfavorably, and I should not like to think of Khalid receiving the same.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Enough of this; we have no time to bicker. We must find any of our companions that are trapped here and escape.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Indeed? Well, despite your... wit, he would be a great help in our escape. Better that we make use of all our strengths, rather than pick apart our weaknesses.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You have changed in this place. You would abandon your friends? Whether you remember or not, we have shared the path here. Is that to be forgotten?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It would be best to face the culprit another day on our own terms, so go and be quick. We must free ourselves soon.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Such callous disregard! We have fought together and traveled long! You would toss that aside like so much rubbish?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I neither understand nor appreciate such humor. If you are to effect my release, best you set to doing it.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Know you well that this will not be forgotten! You have turned as I thought you might, and will get what is deserved!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I do not recall you being so cold. Perhaps I have had some memory loss myself, but this will not be forgotten. If I live, I shall see you pay.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do not get too close; if I could reach you, you would regret it.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Where? He who sneaks up on Minsc loses teeth!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Stop it! Boo is not for you, tiny! You'll hurt him!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No, I know best when talking of Boo. If you could hear his wishes, you would agree, but you cannot. The words of Boo are for Minsc alone.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I can and will. And another thing; no more sneaking Boo crackers. He is getting rather portly, and the crumbs make for an itchy bedroll.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Eh, weather is nice... mmmaybe...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: *grunt*

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What is too bad?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What do you mean?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: An itch? Can you not scratch it?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What can Minsc do to help? A tragedy, this is! I will slay those that need slaying!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It is only fair, big-nosed little one. We will do all that we can to aid you.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You will not steal Boo from me! I know your tricks!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo shall comfort the little dying gnome for a moment. Only a moment!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Alone? No, I draw the line... hey! Stand still! I warn you!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I'll throttle you with your own arms if you do not return him this instant! This is no longer amusing! It was never amusing! I am not laughing!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: That's right, you apologize! It's hard enough keeping Boo's roaming in check without you stealing him. Bad Jan! There will be a booting if this happens again!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You had best leave, and quickly. If I find my release from here, I will have your head on a pike! It will be as I should have done long ago!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do you think me so weak of mind as to believe you, or so weak of spirit as to beg you? No, your choice is made clear and I will not indulge you further.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And I have cause to believe this? I think not. Prove your intent by actually carrying out the deed, and then we shall see if I must kill you or not.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do what you will. You have already proven as reliable as a tamed owlbear.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I shall see you again; you had best count on that. There will be blood that pays for your lies.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Hello again, I see you have not had much luck. Do keep trying. We should leave this place as soon as we are able.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I should hope so. If we stand about much longer, we are sure to be caught once more.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do not think me overly domineering; I am just eager to leave. Please hurry.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You have my gratitude, but I'll not look at you the same way again. You should not indulge that side of yourself. It does not honor the memory of Gorion.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: So be it. I thank you for my "rescue." If we meet again, I doubt it will be as pleasant as this. Take care; you've certainly chosen a rocky path.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I must go. I think it is best that I leave before our host returns. Perhaps we will meet again, and perhaps it will be under favorable terms. I doubt it.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No matter, as I will not be put off so easily. I will join and follow as you see fit. See that we do not stray too far afield lest I regret my decision.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Perhaps we shall meet again, and perhaps we shall even both be on the side of right. Perhaps, though it does not look likely.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I still believe you will choose the right path, and I shall be at your side while you do. I hope you do not disappoint, or make me regret my decision.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Well, that is a relief, and about time too. We should be going immediately. Not only might our "host" come back, I simply must see the sun again in none too short a time. This dank place stifles me.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: As you would have it, though there are other friends we must find as well. It is good to share your company again.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This place has hardened your manner. I do not remember you being so quick with a cold remark. Lead on as you wish, but do tread carefully, will you?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I would disagree with your logic. Once noticed, would not smaller groups be more likely to be captured? There is safety in the company of friends.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: An effective plan, but as cold and calculating as the walls that hold us. So be it, but it won't be I that is captured. Perhaps we will meet again.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Kha... Khalid?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Khalid... No! This... this is an illusion... a dream... a bad dream...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Sil... Silvanus guide the light... to the source. Take this man to what he justly deserves. By... nature's will, what was given is returned; what was turmoil is now... is now peace.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We... we must hurry before we are noticed. We must get out of this... this grave... and seek the light above. Let us go.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You will watch your tongue lest I rip it from your mouth! I, more than anyone, know of the ways life may return, but there is a line that cannot be crossed!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We live in a time of miracles, and nature allows the rebirth of many that have passed beyond the veil, but there is a time when... when it is better to let go.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I will mourn according to what I believe. His death... his death is horrible, but I am still trapped and we are still in danger. Should sorrow doom us all?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Nature is a cycle of birth and... death. Interrupting that cycle isn't... natural! Ah, there's no time for this! I will mourn, but we must still rescue ourselves!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That is the way of things. There will be... there will be payment for this crime, and I shall not rest until it is collected. When we are able, there will be...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Enough. I would leave this place.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I will not suffer this! You will learn the limits and understand, but I will not bear this idiocy now! Find your own path; I will not travel with you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You will learn. There are things that cannot change, and others that cannot remain. And others...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Another day! We must live to pose a bigger threat! There is no point joining the fray today; we would only end up dead or back in our cells. Another day...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Of course I am afraid; what fool wouldn't be? We were captured with little difficulty, held with even less, and have escaped with friends dead or wounded.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We will exact vengeance when it is to our advantage. I will not start a losing battle. A guaranteed loss is a fool's endeavor. Another day... another day...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Only an idiot is not afraid when they should be. We were captured and held with ease! Yes, we have earned our freedom, but it was at the cost of our friends!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Agreed. We will exact justice when we have hope of succeeding. Until then... I will not forget. Another time and place...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I know this place... these buildings. Yes, that person was assuredly correct; this is Athkatla. We are in the state of Amn.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No, Athkatla is along the lower edge of the Sword Coast. I wonder whom we angered that we should be brought here? We should lay low, perhaps in the slums.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Regardless, we will have to make sure we are out of sight for a while. I might know a few safe places here and there, by the docks or outside of town.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Whatever our enemy, we should keep low for a while. Perhaps at the docks or out of town. I might know a few places.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I would suggest the slums. There will be low-profile work, especially at the Copper Coronet. Someone might have heard of our capture or know where Imoen is.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You might have never been here, but I have. Those Who Harp tend to travel. Khalid... Khalid and I came here... well, let us just say I have been here before.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That would solve nothing, and would abandon Imoen to her fate. No, if we were captured before, then we can be captured again, so we must secure ourselves here.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... I am sorry? Do I know you?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Forgive me, but I will require a little more information. Your name again?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No... no, I am terribly sorry, but your face is unfamiliar. Perhaps if you told me what you do...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I remember well, but I wanted you to say it, and I wanted others to hear. Quite the outburst, Mister Ployer. I assume you are still at odds with your new life?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: MISTER Ployer, I wanted you *dead* instead of merely humiliated! The courts did not seem to think death was warranted, so they claimed your assets instead.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He is none of your concern. If you value your teeth, you will not speak that name again. You dirty it.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Well, the slander is going a bit far. You actually were a slaver, you know. It's not slander if it's proven.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I don't think that word means what you think it means. You really were trading in slaves, you know? How am I libelous...?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What have you just done, Ployer? Speak!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Nobody made you a slaver; you just loved the profit! Now you blame those that caught you because you cannot take responsibility? You are a weak, weak man!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: By the horns of Silvanus, I'll plant him beneath the Stones of Aisath if I... if I...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No, I... I'm fine. I just felt a little strange for a moment. That... that fat excuse for a slaver, he's cursed me! Damn him!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Try not to shout, please? My head is unsettled at the moment. There... it clears somewhat, but undoubtedly there will be more. That fat old slaver cursed me!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: For the moment, though I do feel a touch under the weather. Damn him! I'll see his slaving heart stopped for this!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I doubt he would have bothered if the cure were quite so simple. If this curse was tailored to me, then we've no recourse but to exact its cure from his hide.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The Harpers do not operate like that. No, I bet only the one who cast it can remove it. It likely resists conventional means if it was tailored to me.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I beg your pardon? I am to be cast out because of this? What is your reasoning?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That may be my only option. If it was tailored to me, it might resist removal by normal means. I doubt Ployer would have done this if the solution were simple.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have a few options. Ployer mentioned that he lived in squalor, suggesting he may be in the poor section of the city. Not likely to find him quick though.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He also mentioned Belgrade, a merchant that helped expose Ployer. He frequents the Copper Coronet, and the bartender Bernard might know his whereabouts.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He also mentioned Belgrade, a merchant that helped expose Ployer. He frequents the Copper Coronet, and the bartender Bernard might know his whereabouts.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: True, there is a lot of ground to cover, but it seemed clear that he lives in squalor. I would begin in the poor sections of the city. It will take some time.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Again this side of you surfaces. I should not have believed your apologies in Irenicus's dungeon. I will not spend a... *cough*... a moment more in your company!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You *cough* surprise me. To think this cold streak was within and I had only glimpsed it until now. Well then, I will cause you no more inconvenience.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That is not *cough* amusing, and it's not the first time you have acted such. Perhaps you are colder than you let on, but I have little choice but to follow.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: There is always a better path than simply abandoning those that are weak. You will not keep allies by demonstrating that you are willing to sacrifice them.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Very well, though I should like to try and find Belgrade eventually. It has been... *cough*... it has been some time since we talked.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A good first step. Hopefully he can give us some idea where Ployer might... *cough*... might be.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Ooohhh... mm! I did not find resting at all comfortable last eve. I... *cough*... I just couldn't bring my eyes to close. My head pounds as thunder behind my temples.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Aye, that I am, but well enough to walk. I will see that Ployer pay for this. Blasted slaver!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am rested well enough. I will not coddle this curse. Sleeping may ease the aching, but it won't help remove it. Only finding that Ployer will do that.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Lazy, am I? I wouldn't wish a wasting on many, but you come close. Ah, I have no time to bicker. We must continue on lest this affliction progress too far.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I see. So despite assurances, you are indeed the bastard I thought you were after that stunt in Irenicus's jail. Oh, I remember, and I'll remember this too.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do not joke so! I am in grave straits, and you mock my condition with talk of leaving?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You can get me Ployer. Never have I been so mad at another living thing. All this because he could not admit responsibility. He is irredeemable.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I see. Then I will waste no more of your time. I will seek help on my own, and damn you for being so cold. Farewell. We will not meet again.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: My very bones ache today. It is as though I age on the inside. Ohh, this cannot go on for long.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Oh, I shall certainly save it. I shall save it just long enough to bring the fury of Mother Earth upon that fat slaver that would imprison her children.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What do you mean by that? Am I not worth the effort of rescue? Have you better things to do?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Forgive my outburst as well; I am... *cough*... I am not myself. Come, we must go. I will see that slaver pay for this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Despicable... *cough* *cough*... despicable wretch! You knew I would come here?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am... I am not here to grovel, Ployer. You would sooner get that from my corpse!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I- *COUGH* I AM NOT HERE TO GROVEL! I may be weak, even dying, but you WON'T get that! I have come to take what is mine! I (ehrm) will be free of you... of your...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I feel... weak, but better. I... *cough* *cough*... I thank you for helping me through this. You have earned my gratitude and... ehh... and I should really get a full day of rest.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Ahh, yes, I'm the one with enemies we need to worry about. Do you even believe that yourself? Don't make me lau... ow... laugh.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I certainly hope so. Such weakness... I swear, if I meet his like again, I'll not let the courts spare him. I'll... I'll be better after a night's rest.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Like him? No. Well, perhaps, though he was certainly one of the more wretched. I doubt we'll see any more like him, though we'll never want for enemies.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: *yawn*... I'm... I live to see the Earthmother's dawn once more? Then... then you have succeeded. Excellent. And Ployer? What of him?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Indeed. I am glad to be rid of his foul curse. Odd bit of magic that. Onward then. I am fit for travel.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am, I am. With luck, we shall not meet the like of him again. With luck.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: There is no need to get excited. I am sorry to have caused such trouble. I shall just die outright in the future. Do not say a word. Let us go.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Good riddance. It was years overdue. Most of his ilk in my past suffered a more final version of Harper justice. Let us go; I have sat about too long.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The mages with him wore odd colors that might be traceable. Ask at the government building, as all magic is regulated in Athkatla. If they will talk...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No deals for a slayer of Harpers.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I'm... I'm fine, Bernard. I just need...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Bernard, I'm FINE. I just need... need some information. I need to find Belgrade.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: BERNARD! Bernard, this is important. I need to contact him. I know you can connect with the network when you need to, so...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: D... dead? When?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Bernard, please. I need to know where they found Belgrade. I also need to know if you have seen Baron Ployer.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I see... Thank you, Bernard. I... I really must be going now.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Drenden, I... I am dying.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No arguments from... from me.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Drenden, they have done nothing to me... I am... cursed. It cannot be removed. I cannot... I feel...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It's... all right. Find... find Ployer and...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says fight hard, so I fight hard.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Space hamsters are never wrong!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: AHHHH! Minsc will be free! These bonds will not hold my wrath! Butts will be liberally kicked in good measure!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Time is short for talk that is small! Release me! I will rain beatings down upon all who have dared touch me and... and... Dynaheir! She will be avenged!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: NO! No control! No mercy! I will avenge... avenge... Dynaheir!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I know not who has done this, but I will avenge most viciously the wrongs they... the wrongs... Dynaheir! I will cave their skulls for what they have done!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I will continue my adventures with you, and... and... those that do evil will pay dearly for their actions! So swears Minsc! On Dynaheir's grave, so swear I!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I will exact penance from each and every wicked soul that dared lay a finger on...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Will you help? We must join together once more, and our fury will be such that bards will run their quills dry! Yes, ink will be scarce where'er we go!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Trapped? Her spirit... her spirit is trapped in a cage created by my failure. I was to guard her, but she... she...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo points, I punch! Is very simple relationship, but it is effective.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Reconsider! I will rage as never before, and those in my path will fall left, right, and 'round the back! Dynaheir is... she is dead, and I will not rest...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: If anything, I shall be even more single-minded in my focus! Minsc is Minsc, and it shall always be so. Come, Boo, we are among friends again!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Come, we must go now. Yes, Minsc and Boo and you, together again. Beware villains! I will force justice down your evil, evil throats!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You are filth... that I called friend! Do not make me add your ass to the kicking list! I would do so reluctantly, but I will do it! Choose your path now!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You lie! You freed yourself, and now you will not free me! Such villainy! Boo sees what you are doing!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Come, Boo, we must go! What? Yes, of course. My hamster says he will miss you. Such loyalty you inspire, even in rodents. Be proud, as Minsc is.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc and Boo are Minsc and Boo, and we shall not be separated. Shall we go? The butts of evil await my bootprint!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is the best purchase I ever made, and despite my head wound I could tell that his previous owner was good and honest. Boo is an asset to us all!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I have lost myself in your words, but Boo thinks you're just ducky. Onward!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We do good things here! All will remember the heroes that are Minsc and Boo and you!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Nonsense! All enjoy the sight of heroes. We'll be the talk of the town for days! Wave to the nice people, Boo. Wave to the nice hamster, people. WAVE!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes! Lead evil by example, and one day we need no longer put the boots to those that stray off the path of goodness into the muck and bile of villainy and track great bloody footprints across our lily-white tiles! Boo will have clean wood shavings, you evil bastards!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Good has no need of low profiles! There is no shame in boasting if one follows through, and I am not about to keep my voice low! Perhaps Boo will, but not I!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We follow the path that surely leads to glory! Boo is proud to be here, I can tell.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Then say it louder! We must inspire fear in evil! Quiet tales of hamsters are foolish, but a man and his hamster that tear evil limb from limb? That's scary!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Now you are speaking the language of Minsc! Next we must get you a hamster! Or perhaps an ice weasel, whatever your tastes.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It's good that I know you are kidding. I would hate to have to cleanse my own party of evil. Always strive to be on the safe end of the justice boot.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I know I think clearly because Boo tells me so. That is enough for me, though it never seems to be enough for anyone else. Their loss, for I am content.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: As long as some are scared and tell the rest, that is all that matters. Come, we must press on against the tide of naughtiness. Mind your step.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I don't understand the reference, but Boo enjoyed it. An omen of good things... or of horrible and humorous death, I am not sure which.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: These acts will place our names in the songs of skalds and bards from here to my home! There can be no doubt.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I will not tolerate actions such as this! We should strive to be just and fair.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: When making a glorious egg dish of goodness, I understand some eggs must be broken. But actions such as this are... simply deplorable!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Words are just loud air. Actions must take priority in my mind. A phrase might cause some discomfort, but it is good deeds that cause evil the most pain.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: That is all that can be asked. A crusade might be better, but few have the focus required. I will be the example if anyone wishes to follow in my wake.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: A hero needs no profit. A sword is just a few coins; armor is only a few more. No, it is evil that needs gold to fund their machinations, not heroes.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I, uh... I could use a bit of a lie-down... lest I drop Boo on the battlefield. Have we a healer near?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes, that would be best. I should not like evil to get the jump on a weakened Minsc. We must be at our best for the fight to come.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc is no weakling! I have survived more than you could bear! It is just unwise to let wounds go untreated! Enemies will find their work half done already!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I know this, but Boo worries.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ugh! We must rest and get healthy. It would not do for us to be caught unsuspecting with Minsc in this kind of shape.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I do not get through many battles without injury. Why is Minsc always on the front line taking damage?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Perhaps I am a touch quick to combat, but I temper my temper with common sense about who I should attack. What? I do too! Why does Boo snicker?

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: So, there is sanity in all this madness. If you are not in league with the evil that dwells in this unholy place, Yoshimo begs your assistance.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: If I protect more people by being at the forefront, then so be it! I shall charge in an instant and make my enemies sorry they were born as bad as they are!

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I share your sentiments. I have seen much here that has disturbed me. I myself am a warrior with no evil intentions. Please, I would welcome any assistance you might offer.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I am no fiend! I am Yoshimo! You know, Yoshimo?

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I do not know how long I was there before awaking.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: If that is what you think, then you do not know Minsc. I never cower! Boo does, but he fears being underfoot. I do not! I am the over-foot placing evil at end-of-boot!

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I do not know a way to escape this place. Perhaps we could search for this exit together.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: These little beasties keep coming in through the portals. Perhaps if the portals are destroyed, one could defeat the beasts that have already come through.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Perhaps then Yoshimo's predicament won't seem so funny!

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: You must be new to Amn, or at least Athkatla.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: At last, an admirer! I do not know a way to escape this place. Perhaps we could search for this exit together.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: If it was the former, this place could be anywhere. If it was the latter, then I don't imagine that I could have traveled very far without noticing.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: What do you need to know?

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: If you are ever in Athkatla and need some assistance, I reside at the Copper Coronet, an inn of some renown. First, however, a warning...

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I shall survive by taking the wise path. Go ahead and forge the trail. I will follow your path once I have rested a bit.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I shall be happy to lend my blade to your cause. There are two things that I have discovered about this place that may help us escape.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: You have changed your mind? Shall we draw our blades with a common purpose?

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Ah, my desperate, imprisoned friends! You are still alive and enjoying Athkatla's bounty, I see.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I agree. Welcome to the Copper Coronet, my home here in Athkatla. What can Yoshimo offer you? Information? Contacts? Equipment? Perhaps you would like me to join you?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: If you don't care about your party, then it will be you that is left on the battlefield eventually! I can only fight as long as I have my health...

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: There is no need to hurt Yoshimo's delicate feelings. You have dishonored me before these drunkards, thieves, and gamblers. I may never live this down.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Come back and see me when you have more time.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I know of nothing specific here. I would talk to others in this place... adventure always finds its way here. The docks is also an interesting place to find work.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: The barkeep's name is Bernard. He will sell you high-quality equipment at a reasonable price. If you have the time, though, I would suggest the Adventure Mart in the promenade.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I would be honored to wield my sword for you.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Oh, taker of my honor, do not return to torment me further. Unless you have come to take back your cruel words, I ask you to leave now.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Welcome to the Copper Coronet, my home here in Athkatla. What can Yoshimo offer you? Information? Contacts? Equipment? Perhaps you would like me to join you?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is a fine friend, and powerful in ways you don't let yourself see! To insult Boo is to insult all things small that try hard. Oh, and Minsc as well.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc and Boo and you! There can be no greater a team in all the realms!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo likes the forest, but Minsc? Oh, every time Boo plays in the leaves, Minsc has to give him another bath.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Of course he does, and it makes him squirm so much that I fear losing him. If he got loose... I worry what such a powerful creature would do if left unchecked.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Aye, and when we face a foe, I shall show them his pointy teeth!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc has had the pleasure of standing next to many a warrior in battle, but I swear, I have never been as impressed as I am with you, Mazzy.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc does not insult those that fight with honor on the side of right! You may not be as big as Minsc, but very few are.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You are a sight in battle, young Mazzy! Boo has keen interest in the small, and Minsc takes great joy in the honor of combat, hehe, so you are doubly worthy of our company.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I could not be more so! Don't look for subtle messages, I keep nothing hidden. I help the weak and leave evil in my boot print. You are similar... Boo can tell.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Arrgh! Minsc could use a healing touch. Oh, poor Boo; the sight of blood does make him tremble so.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You would seek the path of paladin? A difficult road, and you will find many barriers that sword will not break.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ahh, Boo, Minsc has placed his feet where his head should go once more. No, Mazzy, I meant only that it is a path that is difficult regardless.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You are more like Boo than Minsc. Boo is small, but he is more than people would believe. Evil will see you like they see Boo, and that will help you in the end.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: NOOO! Such a vile act will not go unpunished! Minsc will see this paladin's heart avenged! And Boo shall burrow through your black little souls!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Mazzy! You walk with the living once more! Minsc was so scar... uh... well... Boo! Boo was so scared you were lost to us, but miracles have brought you back!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Of course, brave little one. See, Boo, she is well and as she was. You were foolish to have been worried. Yes... you were.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ahh, this land is fine... but I wish I could show Boo the fields of Rashemen. We could run free through the snow... ah, though Boo would look some kind of funny in a drift, I tell you this. Ha ha!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No, it is as real as Minsc, though even larger! It lies far in the direction of the sun at morning. Ah, but it has been long since I left it.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I was on my dajemma, a journey to prove my manhood! Oh, we were a pair, me and my witch! I was to watch over Dynaheir and bring her home in... in safety.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You have been good friends, you and you... Minsc would ask something! Will you be my witch, Aerie? Boo and I are nothing without a witch...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: My sword, my soul, my hamster... all of these I pledge to... to Aerie, my witch... HEAR THAT, EVIL? MINSC HAS A NEW WITCH! WOE IS YOU!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You are okay, Aerie?... Boo tried his best to save you.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Wine, everyone! Song! The witch lives!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo wishes you well, young Mazzy. Minsc does too. May evil fear your bootfall wherever you tread.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: All will fall before the might of Minsc and Boo! Evil all about! All will... FAAARRRRGHHH!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I will fight! Minsc fights and evil falls!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I will... I... Keldorn?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: RRRAAAAGH! KILL, SAYS BOO! KILL, DOES MINSC!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Raaagh! Ra... Minsc... Minsc is... better now. Boo calms as we speak. Thank you, paladin.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc is calm. Boo is calm. You are wise in your words and bear your weapon well. Would that you could hear Boo's praise, for my own words do not suffice.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Who wants a piece of Minsc? Who? Evil will die here! Enemies everywhere!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Friends... my friends...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc calms... you are right... Thank you, Keldorn. You are... an inspiration to me.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You bear the wounds of battle well, Keldorn. A warrior of your ability would be well respected in my home of Rashemen.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This, Boo, this is a hero of legend! Minsc is honored to fight at your side, Keldorn!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yet more scars that show Minsc's prowess in battle! All great warriors wear such marks. Keldorn, you must have a great many scars that are your medals of combat! Do you wear them proudly, as Minsc does?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I did not think of it that way, though scars are my proof that I will fight evil to the last. It places fear in the hearts of the enemy.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I can respect that, though I would rather my enemies know I am coming and that there is little they can do.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! For such a warrior to fall here is an abomination! And I do not even know the word! All will feel my boot to head for this!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oh, your legacy did not die! You are with us again! Oh, Boo is positively vibrating with happiness! Minsc will not let such evil claim you again!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I do not like to think of those I have lost as gone. I may not speak of them much, but they are in each swing of my sword as I avenge them!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ah! Minsc... *pant* Minsc breathes! Boo! Where is Boo? Oh, there you are. You did not leave me. A miracle is this!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: And Boo would have it no other way! Minsc lives. Beware evil!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Cernd, you are akin to nature as I am. Why did you not take up the blade to fight? I do not think I would have the patience you do in battle.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Confused looks from all sides, but Minsc understands!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Flowers are beautiful, aren't they, Boo? I wish there were more to see.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I don't understand much that is complicated, but the trees and the flowers are music to my eyes. Boo prefers the calm of the forest, though he suffers my company.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No, he is my hamster. You talk in circles, Cernd, but that's okay. Boo runs in them.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You are not as serious as many druids I have met, Cernd. Some even disapprove of me because I am... I am... I'd... hmm... I don't really know why. Boo will not tell me either.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You could just say you don't know. Boo makes more sense, and he does not have thumbs.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: it is good to see you again.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: NO! I did not kill her!

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: She, uh, released me from bondage. I am a free man again and ready to rejoin your party.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Please, do not be angry with me. The nymph enchanted me, but she has since freed me. I am a free man again and ready to rejoin your party.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I did not hurt the nymph! She released me from the fairy circle. I am a free man again and ready to join your party.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: After the nymph released me, I ran to catch up with you and had a little run-in with a worg. The worg wounded me.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: It is the truth! I would not harm that innocent nymph! She released me from the fairy circle so that I could rejoin my companions. You must believe me!

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I am pleased to travel with you again.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I am very sorry to hear that. You shall find me in Athkatla should you need me. I will be staying at the Copper Coronet. Travel safely.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: When you have thought about this and realized your error, you will find me at the Copper Coronet in Athkatla. I will now take my leave of you.

Speaker: DRYAD
Text: Hold Undead

Speaker: DRYAD
Text: I think that goes without saying.

Speaker: DRYAD
Text: If I had wanted your tutelage, surely I would have asked for it!

Speaker: DRYAD
Text: I know, Yoshimo. I'm not angry with you, really... I'm just nervous. I would feel very guilty if I set off a trap by accident.

Speaker: DRYAD
Text: I will try not to disappoint.

Speaker: DRYAD
Text: Tell me, how did you get into adventuring? It is a dangerous business, as you well know. Any one of us could die without even a moment's notice.

Speaker: DRYAD
Text: I did not so much get into adventuring as it was forced upon me.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo does not understand. It is not as though the scoundrel will be missed, but... where has Edwin gone, and who is this woman that wears his clothes?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Such a temperament! Fire in her belly and not afraid to spit in an eye! It reminds me of the fighting women of my homeland! Ah, sweet lady, you bring me tears.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You bear handsome features, uh... though... they are familiar too, uh... Edwin's sister, perhaps? Hehe. Ah yes, Boo sees the resemblance. You are far his superior in your manner though.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I don't do well with the philosophical. You are Edwin? Ah, like Minsc is Boo and Boo is Minsc because we carry each other within. Do you like hamsters? Boo likes you.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I see more and more of Edwin in your tone, though still you are better company than he. Boo will forgive you for now.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I think she warms to our company, Boo. See how she looks longingly?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Your words are strange, wizard. Stranger still are the thoughts behind them. Er, stand back a step if you don't mind. Boo has expressed a dislike for your company, and I cannot say I am surprised...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I am quite used to people mocking Boo. It no longer bothers either one of us. Laugh if you will, but Minsc hears what you cannot.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Opposite of... lesson... less on... more on! The opposite of less on is more on! More on? Do you dare to insult me once again?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: The Red Wizard risks great harm. Boo is sensitive, and may not just go for the eyes!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You pick at old wounds, wizard! Continue to press and I shall make you some fresh ones!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You are one step away from wearing your lips as a collar, wizard! Withdraw your foolish words!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Then you shall pay the price for your "observations"! Those that speak ill of the dead shall join them! May you spend eternity with Dynaheir's foot in your loins!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Think hard on this! This matter is near and dear my own heart, and it deserves due care and attention!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I do not like the tone of your voice, dark elf! The face I have is the face the ladies love! Boo loves Minsc's face, too. Don't you, Boo? Don't you? Yes!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says that he was just doing his job.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says that Yoshimo did well, too... for someone who isn't Minsc.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Do you see that, Boo? There goes a nice man.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I said not to...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You do not need to...

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: Protect me!

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: Yes, help us!

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: Free us!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I make claim that you are an affront to all nature. You are a disruption that will not be allowed, and I will fight with the power of my faith and conviction.

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: We are his possessions.

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: His servants.

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: His concubines. Please help us to escape!

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: But you must help us get free of this... creature Irenicus!

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: Please, friend! His dungeon is death all around!

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: He has kidnapped us and kept us here for more time than I can count.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You will accept this challenge, and we will proceed! I will not have this place remain in your "care"! By the Great Mother, you will not leave the duel alive!

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: Please stay and help us! We must escape from this... this Irenicus!

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: If you can escape, you must take our acorns to the Queen. Tell her of our plight in this creature's lair.

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: Take them to the Fairy Queen who lives in the south end of the Windspear Hills. This will be our deliverance from this... this Irenicus and his dungeon!

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: You can foil his plans for us at least. If you take the acorns to the Fairy Queen, then she can regrow our trees and free us!

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: Please do not forget about us! I have been so long away from the sun! I do not know how much longer I can stand it...

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: If you will not help us, then we will take your human male until you change your mind. Please! We do not want to have to do this.

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: Unless you agree to help us, you cannot have your man back.

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: We cannot leave our trees!

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: If we are separated from our trees, we will die.

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: Our trees will die, too!

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: Have we not suffered enough? Take pity, friend!

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: Thank you! You must take the acorns and deliver them to the Fairy Queen in the south end of the Windspear Hills.

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: We will help you escape! You must use the portals to travel up to the next level of the complex. This is how Irenicus travels. The portals are triggered by a certain key.

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: He uses Her key. He still loves her, you see. He keeps her room just as it was, though well protected. We go there sometimes and look at her things.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Umph! Boo! Where are you, Boo? Let the good knight know that I have hit my head!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No, Boo. The knight, I said... not all these pesky birdies...

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: May the forest always open a path for you!

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: We do have such a flask. If you will agree to take our acorns to the Fairy Queen, we will give it to you.

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: If you take the acorns to the Fairy Queen, then she can regrow our trees and free us! She lives in the south end of the Windspear Hills! Will you do this for us?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc doesn't get mad, Minsc gets eve... no, wait, Minsc gets mad...

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: Thank you! Here is the flask.

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: We will not give you the flask if you will not help us. Return to me if you change you mind. We must escape from this place!

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: Will you help to free us now?

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: Will you help to free us now?

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: Will you help to free us now?

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: You have returned, traveler. Is there something else that you require of us?

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: You must use Irenicus's portals to travel up to the next level of the complex. The portals must be triggered by a certain key.

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: He uses Her key. He still loves her, you see. He keeps her room just as it was, though well protected. We go there sometimes and look at her things.

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: You have returned, traveler. Is there something else that you require of us?

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: You have returned, traveler. Is there something else that you require of us?

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Aaa... who be thee? Servants of the master?

Speaker: Rielev
Text: I am... dying... or dead... I remember not which. Where is the master?

Speaker: Rielev
Text: He was my friend, I think... cast out, and one of us no longer... I cannot remember... Are you to take my place?

Speaker: Rielev
Text: It is difficult to... to remember... I was Rielev... dead, I think.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Suspended, I be... I am... dying... dead. No matter, I must be your cruel dream as you are mine.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Strangers be ye? Aaaa... things have gone... bad... since I have died. Threaten not the master, for you shall... surely... perish... Driven is he, and power he seeks...

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Prisoners be ye? Truly I have been... dead, but not dead too long. I seek... release... I have been alone for... too long. The master can take nothing more... I am forgotten.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Neither, neither. I am... between... the master has forgotten me... not killed me.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Please! I am alone here. For too long, alone. If you must... escape... release me...

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Eternal... life... was to be my reward for faithful service. The master has suspended me until he can cure me... return my youth to me...

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Release... yes! Master! I-I no longer wish to come back! Let me slip into the oblivion that has been denied me! Please!

Speaker: Rielev
Text: I know not... Days... years... It is all the same, and my mind cannot grasp it. All alone.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: He has forgotten because he does not wish to remember... what was taken... I barely remember myself.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: They may know how the master exits the complex. Will you take these cells to revive them and learn what you can, in return for this path to freedom I have offered ye?

Speaker: Rielev
Text: I thank ye... go and leave me to oblivion at last.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: You are heartless. I again feel hate.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Leave me! Take the crystals and return me to oblivion!

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: The wands are locked onto the pedestals, and you would do well to search out the keys and take down the wands before walking through the hall. Again I say, farewell!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is no rat, tiny one. He is a space hamster, and he will go for the eyeballs of children who call him rat.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Thank you, child. Surely you have better things to be about, however, so begone.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No. I have had enough of tiny people trying to steal Boo. Away!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Stupid is as stupid does, young one. So says Boo.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What is this "clap" you speak of, child? Enough. Begone, you are disturbing me.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! Boo is NOT for eating! Boo is mighty and wise and probably quite stringy. Er, and he is my companion!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I am sorry. I am only for Boo and my witch.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He... Khalid... is dead, and has been so for some time! Beyond a point, there can be no raising, especially when the body has been... has been desecrated!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Yes, there are greater spells that raise even the aged dead, but they leech from the caster, and I will not ask that of someone! Khalid would not have it!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We live in a time of miracles, and nature allows the rebirth of many that have passed beyond the vale, but there is a time when... when it is better to let go.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You will not speak ill of my life with Khalid! I will answer such insults with lethal intent, and rightfully so! You cannot know... you cannot!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Your opinion is of a fool that thinks magic and spells are the ultimate forces that shape our lives! You will learn that some... some things are unalterable!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We cannot prevail here; best we leave until we can. Another day, another place; there will be righteous vengeance, but in its own time. Oh yes... in time.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I doubt we would have come this far if a battle were not distracting our host! We will exact punishment when we can; there is no point in dying here.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I expect less of you with each utterance. I have said what I know, and you can take it or leave it. Ask around and you will know I speak the truth.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I was wondering the same, though we are not all that far from home and organizations can span continents. Perhaps it is not an individual that seeks our heads.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I do not know the city well enough to give directions though. We will have to seek out the slums. Perhaps we may find who holds Imoen still.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Perhaps in the slums, we will find who planned this, or who has Imoen still. I have heard that the Copper Coronet is a good place to find information.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I can speak for myself, human. And I can assure you that I am not "available," as you put it.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: you decides if I enjoy my spirits. Such friendly froth sometimes makes me dizzy, but I thank you for the offer. So does Boo.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: *yawn*... I'm... I live to see the Earthmother's dawn once more? Then... then you have succeeded. Excellent. And Ployer? What of him?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Indeed. I am glad to be rid of his foul curse. Odd bit of magic that. Onward then. I am fit for travel.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have you to thank, I assume. Of course I do. You have proven quite the friend. Shall we... continue our adventures? I believe I am fit for travel.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am sorry to have caused you all this trouble. I shall just have them kill me outright in the future. Do not say a word. Let us go.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Good riddance. I should have done such years ago when I discovered him and his network. Harper justice for the wicked. Shall we go? I am fit for travel.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I am not impressed by fighting slaves. But I would CRUSH any true opponent who dared to face me!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is good to be back in the company of friends, is it not? I did miss being able to partake in the camaraderie.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am ready and willing, and I thank you for not indulging my illness. Weak I may have been, but I'll not have anyone coddle me.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That might be best, though I shall not impose upon my druidic brethren further. I shall wait at the Harper base within Athkatla. Yes, that would be best.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: There you are! I-I missed you while I was gone. I-I mean... well, I am glad to see you. I must tell you, however, that we must go to the Harper Hold in Athkatla.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You are coming from Rashemen? I remember it fondly and hope to take Boo to see it once I have completed my dajemma.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No. Boo is my hamster. And Boo is my friend.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Hail there! I said I would return, and I have. Sorry to have kept you waiting, but there were things I had to take care of. Now that we have met once again, there is something I must ask of you. We must go... we must go to the Harper Hold in Athkatla.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do I know of you? Have you reason to subject me to your rude manner? I have no coin, if that is your wish.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I do not follow by a stranger's command. Who are you?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... Yes, I see. If you would give me a moment, I will do what needs be done.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Relax, I will not be gone long. Please, I will explain when I return. I... I do not wish to be apart from you too long. I will return when I can.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Try not to worry, I can take care of myself. I will return as soon as possible. I have obligations elsewhere that must be attended to.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have obligations elsewhere. Worry not, I will return shortly. You will survive without me for a time.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No one is disputing that, but I do have obligations outside the group. I will return when I am able.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have been asked to bring you, and we must go soon. They will allow us to pass the wards of the door, but I must be with you, and I must be conscious.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I thank you, and I... I will tell you what I can when it is time. I am sorry... I am sorry to ask this of you, but it is my duty to do so. Come, let us go.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Thank you, I am glad to be back in your company. I only wish it were not under such circumstances. Come, we must go. I will explain more when it is time.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Remember your obligations elsewhere. We have to go to the Harper Hold in Athkatla as soon as possible. It would not be good to keep them waiting too long.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We should make our way to the Harper Hold in Athkatla as soon as we are able. I do not look forward to the trip any more than you do, but we must.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Please, it is very important that we go to the Harper Hold in Athkatla. They were very insistent that I bring you there, and we must go soon.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am a Harper in my heart; you know this. It is my duty to bring you to them, but... but I no more want to make the trip than you do. Nevertheless, we must go.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Very true, but I am a Harper, as you know. They ask that I bring you. I will not make you go, and I will not leave you, but eventually we must.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Harpers will wait an eternity for vengeance or justice, though defining the two is sometimes difficult. They made it clear I was to bring you to them.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Please, do not make this difficult. I have a duty to take you, and I will not rest easy until we have gone. I will not force you, but eventually we must go.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Your welcome is forced, Galvarey. You know I am here at the bidding of the Herald. Why have you come to greet me? This is too important to waste time on you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are no Herald! What is going on here?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I know you are an ambitious fool. You cannot be sanctioned to do this. Even this gaudy base is against our usual restraint. The position of Herald requires...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Fine, set about with your questions so I can get on with my job as well.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Please.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Galvarey, siblings we are in Harper blood, but if you do not cease your tongue, I shall remove it!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Mind yourself, this is very serious.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Please, do not make this difficult for yourself.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are twisting their words, Galvarey. That is not what they meant.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Why do you ask the question if you are going to infuse the answer with your own meaning? you would never...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Only in your mind. This is a farce!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This is a difficult situation! Would you react any different?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What has *that* to do with anything?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And also the sky, or the ocean! You are so intent on seeing what you wish the answer does not matter!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And also of apples, or the rose! You are so intent on seeing what you wish the answer does not matter!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And also of the sun above, or the daisy! You are so intent on seeing what you wish the answer does not matter!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And also of the grass, or the leaves in the trees! You are so intent on seeing what you wish the answer does not matter!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And also of the night sky, or the coat of a fine steed! You are so intent on seeing what you wish the answer does not matter!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Now you are really stretching! What of clouds that bring life to the soil, or the purity of undyed wool? You see what you wish; the answer does not matter!

Speaker: Rielev
Text: This... unit that contains me is powered by cells, by crystals. Take them and I can sleep... die... again die at last.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: I know you are prisoners. Some things do not change. You must escape this place and the master's experiments. There are others... like me, but of more recent experiments...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Thank you, but no. Tonight I am fine as I am.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: But you were to see you as they is, not as you expected them to be! I was to bring them here so...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am sorry, this was not my intent at all! I thought...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Indeed, Galvarey, what is it you intend? This is not as we had discussed...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: My... what? You are questioning me? You subject him to this... this witch hunt and you think I am the one that is to be questioned?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And what if they will restore the balance? What if their intent is good?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: As Harpers, we respect others!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is as good as death and you know it, Galvarey!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Nay, Galvarey, there is but you and your four lackeys. I will have no part in this!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... I will stand by your side if you will have me. You are... you are better than this, I know. I...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: So... so be it, then. I will... I must not... I will have no part in either side of this!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: These are no friends of mine! I do not recognize them!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Harpers may interfere, but it is for the greater good! Not this! I don't know you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: you are my comrade in arms. I know you are good and true in heart. I will fight with you against this!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am Harper. I cannot fight by your side against my own, but I will not take part in this! I... I cannot side with either. Goodbye.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is about time you returned; I have been waiting here for who knows how long! We'd best get back together and get moving; I'll not serve nature or my fallen comrades by sitting about here.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Your loss, to be sure. I'll be here or in the vicinity. I want to be sure you can find me. We are bound on the same course, though different paths.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Good and done. We should make all speed to our destination.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You have returned to my company, but I no longer know you. Tales of your deeds have spread before you... and the Harpers have kept certain tabs on you at all times. You will find no quarter here! Justice will take you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I-I had hoped to see you again. I... ah, that is, it is good to see you well! I have heard good things... for the most part at least. Shall we team once more? You and I both have much left to do.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I will, but only as a comrade in arms. Perhaps there was a chance for more, but no longer. It is for the best; we have friends to avenge.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: For... yes, for the sake of the group. We have friends to avenge and should get to it. Other... other things will wait. Yes, I will come with you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Yes... yes, it is best to move on. I will be here or near here if you should change your mind, but I think we will always be separate in some measure now.

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: But he has taken the acorns. He knows of our plans. It amuses him.

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: He has left our acorns with Ilyich. Ilyich is mean!

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: Ilyich is the clan chief of the master's duergar slaves. He is somewhere within the dungeon. Return to us when you have the acorns, and we will tell you how to escape.

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: You must get our acorns back from Ilyich, the clan leader of Irenicus's duergar slaves. He is somewhere within the dungeon. Return to us when you have the acorns, and we will tell you how to escape.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is about time you followed. Please, we should not keep them waiting any longer. The Harpers bid me to bring you here and expect me to do so. I will join the group once more, and we will go inside.

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: You have done a noble thing for us. Please take these acorns to the Fairy Queen who lives northeast of the human settlement called Trademeet.

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: You must get our acorns back from Ilyich, the clan leader of Irenicus's duergar slaves. He is somewhere within the dungeon. Return to us when you have the acorns, and we will tell you how to escape.

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: You have done a noble thing for us. Please take these acorns to the Fairy Queen who lives in the south end of the Windspear Hills.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... won't allow that. No, it is best if I am with you. You will not get a fair heari... eh... What I mean is they will respect you more if I vouch for you.

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: You must get our acorns back from Ilyich, the clan leader of Irenicus's duergar slaves. He is somewhere within this dungeon. Return to us when you have the acorns, and we will tell you how to escape.

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: You have done a noble thing for us. Please take these acorns to the Fairy Queen who lives in the south end of the Windspear Hills.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You've got the key that fits? Then open the door already. Must I hand-walk you through this?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What is this? Reviane! What are you doing here? It is I, Jaheira!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What? If this is about the attack at the Harper Hold, you know I would not do such a thing if I had any alternative! They left me no choice!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It was Galvarey; he had me bring my companion there on the pretense of determining their danger, but he had no intention of letting you leave once there.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Bah! He was a fool bent on advancing his own station! His intent was to use you as a trophy, hoping to gain enough influence to become a Herald!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: As you wish. Reviane is of interest because they is one of the Children. Galvarey wished to capitalize on the fear around the prophecies of old.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: If that is your wish. Reviane, suffice to say that Galvarey had an unhealthy interest in my compatriot. You must trust me in this matter.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: you has proven that they is not a slave to their origins, just as Galvarey proved that calling oneself a Harper is not enough to make you one in your heart.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You must do as you will, Reviane. I have told you my circumstance; there is little more for me to say.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: If you attack, you are no better than Galvarey. I will meet your threats with whatever force that I can! Do not do this. Harpers seek the truth...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I will not draw arms against you, Reviane. This has been a huge mistake, and I will not be party to making another.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: As am I, Reviane.

Speaker: PORTAL
Text: I see. If you are loyal followers, then I have little choice but to fight. You shall not take me peaceably to my doom at the hands of my ancestor, of that I am certain.

Speaker: PORTAL
Text: My proposal is that we return to the city and enter the sphere. That way, I will know if Lavok lives. If he does, we can exterminate his ghoulish existence once and for all.

Speaker: PORTAL
Text: I refuse. I prefer the goodwill of the Cowled Wizards and the reward for you.

Speaker: PORTAL
Text: The wizards have not been entirely truthful. How do you propose we solve this?

Speaker: PORTAL
Text: The wizards will not rest until they get inside the sphere. And one cannot hope to stand up to the them for long... at least not without steady hands at one's back.

Speaker: PORTAL
Text: Who are you that makes you so special? How do I know you are not lying to me?

Speaker: PORTAL
Text: Wait! I've a proposal, if you are but willing to hear it!

Speaker: PORTAL
Text: I am the last of the Corthala line. That may mean little to you, but it means plenty to Lavok. When Lavok left Athkatla in the sphere, he was already many centuries old.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Der... Dermin? Is that you? It has been some time.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What is the matter, Dermin? You would not have let me walk on by, would you? I know we did not always see eye to eye, but I assure you, the respect...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Of... of course, you were the one that introduced me to the Harpers.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What... what are you getting at, Dermin?

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: You are very noble to risk your own safety to free the djinni. We have the flask and shall give it to you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I see. And what power has decided that I should be killed? I serve nature and protect the good of the land through my work as a Harper. Who have I offended?

Speaker: Ilyich
Text: Be alert, laddies! We've got company. Ho, prisoners! Ye've come to th' wrong place, I tell ye true! Ilyich and 'is boys'll stop you!

Speaker: Ilyich
Text: Suffice to say, this place is your doom. By the time the master returns, you shall be dead and we shall be rewarded. At 'em, lads! No mercy!

Speaker: Ilyich
Text: I won't be givin' 'em to you. Come and get 'em... if you can!

Speaker: Ilyich
Text: At 'em, lads! No mercy!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have washed my hands of the incident in the Harper Hold. Galvarey was in the wrong and brought his fate upon himself.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He was in the wrong! Of that I am certain! Galvarey sought to imprison you for his own gain, and I took the side of right. I could do no other!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This is wrong, Dermin. This is not the right solution.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do not concern yourself. This was the only course open, even if... I... I wish to not talk of this. This matter is... is behind me. Onward, we have much to do.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I thank you, but part of me is gone. I... I will speak no more of this. This is behind me. I must go forward. Come, we have friends to avenge.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Dermin... I...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Dermin, I cannot do as you ask. You are in the wrong, as was Galvarey. I was right to choose you's side, and it is your loss if you cannot see this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This is not justice. This is revenge for a lie, a falsehood that none seem bothered to find the truth behind. If this is Harper justice, then I...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: If this is the justice you represent, then I... I renounce you. I renounce... I renounce my life as a Harper.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It would seem I am the only one that has thought any of this through. You do not, Galvarey did not, and now the Harpers out for blood do not.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I mourn many fellows of the Harp, but they died fighting for balance and truth. Galvarey did not, and this matter cheapens their loss. I will not be party to it.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is their... it is my duty to "meddle," you. It is only this instance where they are wrong. I cannot go along with this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: you... you do not trust my judgment either? I have stood by you through the mistakes of my own kind, and you still keep your guard around me?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No... no... I do not think it is. You are advocating revenge without thought. You are not giving the balance its due. I... I have little choice here, I think.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Dermin... Dermin, I renounce my life as a Harper.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are right, of course, and they has proven it. No, I think it best if I return to tending the balance with my druidic brethren.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That it is. I know you will not upset the balance, but if you change, we will meet again. I will not be happy if you cheapen my choice here today.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It shall not be peaceful, but it is clearer than the course you are on. Goodbye, Dermin.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Garbage? Do you comprehend the magnitude of what I have done? Do you see... what... no, I will not cheapen this moment by arguing with you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: find your own way. See to it that you continue the course we began. Do not make a liar of me, or we will meet again under violent circumstances.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are no burden; you are why I go on. I have friends to avenge, but life is also for the living. My life is worth pursuing. I... I hope you agree.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Come, enough sadness for the day. We have much to do, and... and together we will not fail.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I take strength from the group, but... more so in your company. I have friends to avenge, but life is also for the living. Life is worth pursuing. I... I hope you agree.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: But... what?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Not the way they tell it, Bernard. You know me, so trust in what I do.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This group is yours to reform as you see fit, though dropping me for another does not seem like the wisest choice. I will abide by your decision though.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Jaheira is what I am called, as you should well know. We have traveled together for some time, and the places we have gone number too many to name.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I cannot stay here, however. I will probably be in Athkatla, as the Harpers have a base of sorts within. If you can find it, that's where I'll be.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Perhaps... this will be for the best. I will try to find assistance from my fellow druids, southwest of Trademeet. They will be able to help, I am sure.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: If you find Ployer in the meantime, be sure to kill him once for me. I would very much appreciate it.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This... this is unexpected. I had thought we were closer than simple group comrades. Not that I doubt you, but should I leave the group, I doubt things will be the same between us.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I do not wish to leave your... company. Certainly you must still want me around? You have said as much, even if not using those exact words.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am glad of this. I have... I have high hopes for what we will accomplish in the future.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You may, but it will not be the same. I will likely be in Athkatla, near the Harper Hold that is there. Take your time in finding me.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I see. If this is the way it shall be... I will probably be in Athkatla, near the Harper Hold. You may seek me there, though it matters little.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This is not wise. We should be making all haste to the Harper Hold in Athkatla. I... I do not look forward to the trip, so I will not force you to go, but it would be best if you complied.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I will await your arrival at the Hold. They will have my assurances that you are on your way. Do not make a liar of me.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I fear the actions of my fellow Harpers may have colored your view of me. I assure you I wish to be in no other place than by your side.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Have I... have I made a mistake investing my time in you? I doubt I will see you in the same fashion if I can be cast aside as any other party member.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... I see. Then I was foolish. I will not... show such weakness again. I will be at the Harper Hold in Athkatla. I look forward... I will await you there.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Then I will stay. Please do not suggest such things again. We must make haste to the Harper Hold in Athkatla. They will not wait forever.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... I beg your pardon? I may have misheard your decision; you... you wish me to leave? But... I wish to be no other place than here, with... with you. I could not come back if I am wrong. Tell me you have misspoken.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That is good to know. I have few others to turn to now and I... I value our time together.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Curse me for a fool then. Why I thought... I will not show such weakness again. So be it; I will venture off on my own.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am not sure where I will go. Goodbye. I do not think we will meet again.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What? You cannot mean- I stood by you through a very difficult time; I have turned my back on many of my own brethren! Am I to be cast aside like any other member of the group? I'm not sure I could return after something like this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I thank you. I have a lot invested in this group, and I should not like to leave just yet.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I see. Well, I will not waste my breath arguing. I will go... I cannot go to the Harpers here. I will go... where? Goodbye, I doubt we shall meet again.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: These little beasties keep coming in through the portals. Perhaps if the portals are destroyed, one could defeat the beasts that have already come through.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: These little beasties keep coming in through the portals. Perhaps if the portals are destroyed, one could defeat the beasts that have already come through.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I have noticed that each wand is locked into the pedestal and could be removed if one had the proper key. I know not where these keys are. Let us begin!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do... I know you? I... Your voice is familiar, but I cannot place your face.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We met among the Harpers, did we not? I am through with them. Many a decent person I met, but damned if I'll be crucified for the failures of their own.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Then do so. I wish this matter behind me once and for all.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... I don't know.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Undoubtedly. I would do as such again without hesitation. you is proven decent, and others are all the more fools for not seeing so.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... I believe I have placed a proper name to your manner, now that I have experienced it up close. I should have thought you fond of anagrams, "Terminsel."

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Wake up, you! Wake up! Come on, we have to get outta here!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: He messed with your head too, huh? All I know is we were near Baldur's Gate and got jumped.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I don't think I want to remember it all. He's been... doing things... to us. we have to get out of here!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Who am I? He messed with your head too, huh? I'm Imoen. We lived in the same place for years.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: You'd better make yourself ready right quick, you goon! Don't you remember getting dragged here?

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I guess I can't blame you for forgetting. All I remember is us getting jumped near Baldur's Gate. It was quick...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: It must be because he's been messing with our heads. I don't remember much, but I know it... it hurt. I just have to get out of here.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Come on, don't make me think of it. He did the same to you, I think. I heard you screaming like it, anyway.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Yeah, me too, but my head hurts the most. Yours too by the sound of the screaming. We just have to get out of here.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Later! I'm sorry, but I'm not sure I could get loose again if he came back! My head hurts so bad...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: It isn't like a normal pain. it's on the inside, like my bones made a little dagger and it won't go away.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Good, because I don't know if I could get loose again if I had to. Not with the pain in my head...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: There was fighting... my cell was damaged. I don't know if I could get out again. The pain in my head is getting worse.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I don't think it's our gear. They probably sold our best stuff, but anything is better than nothing. Now let's go!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Good, I didn't want to go by myself. I need you around. Don't want to be here alone.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Stop being like that! I know it's just because he messed with your head, but that excuse only goes so far.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: I was a... faithful hound to the master. A friend, even. I was... dying... or dead, I cannot remember which. Truly you are a stranger to this place.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I'm not going to step on your tail. You've been the responsible one forever, and I don't plan on making changes here.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: I begin to understand. The master has left my side for study of another. He seeks to awaken power... a study of life and death, but I cannot bear the roll of years.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: My anger is under complete control! Complete! I will control it as I rip limb from limb, I will control it as I pound head after head, and I will control...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Our travels are the stuff of legend! Our victories the subject of song! How could I not follow to find my friends after they disappeared?

Speaker: Minsc
