Text: You speak as a trapped animal, words that I know well. I hold you no grudge, for we have traveled long together, whether you choose to recall or not.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I will not be the only one to lose my head here today! Dynaheir... My charge and friend... she is... she is dead, and I am a failure as her guard!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: They... they killed her as I watched, you see? I know not who they were, but... but I will redeem myself!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: My honor and competence is in question? Oh, I assure you that nothing shall keep me from exacting my righteous wrath on those responsible for this!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Answer they will, and my sword shall be the question! We shall have fistfuls of sweet, sweet justice, and our enemies will be stains beneath our feet!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What...? Yes, but... but... all right. Boo tells me that I am raving again. I did not notice a difference, but I shall heed his words nonetheless.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You... you turn your back on those in need? You are abandoning me in my hour of shame? You... you are no better than those that killed Dynaheir!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: RRAAAAGHGHGH! I will smack your evil lips to the earth and stomp them with the boot heel of justice! I will...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I will make sure you do not live long enough to abandon more friends! I will... I will... I will do all of this as soon as I get these bars open! RRAAAARRGH!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Then I will quest on my own, and we shall meet again when I am worthy of serving in the company of good and true people!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: And that we shall meet again I do not doubt, for wherever there is evil walking funny, there is Minsc's foot, doing the work of goodness!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Don't ask questions better left to aged sages. Boo is quick and evasive, and there is ever so much of Minsc to search; there is no hope of getting us apart.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I am the best kind of warrior! I am large, and I carry nature's favor with me where'er I go!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is my animal companion, and while some smaller rangers might compensate for their size by traveling with bears or wolves, I prefer the subtleties provided by a miniature giant space hamster! Yes, subtle!

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Shortly beyond that chamber, there is a hallway that contains several wands mounted in pedestals. They blast all that walk before them.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: It is actually quite uh... embarrassing. My profession does not leave itself open to those who are not wary, yet somehow I was caught unaware.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I came to Athkatla years ago from Kara-Tur to seek my fortune. At some point, I went to bed in my room at the Copper Coronet, and I awoke in a strange room with a very sore head.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Maybe you should try to face the perils of this place alone!

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I am unsure. I may have been drugged when I was brought here. I may have been unconscious... either way, I do not know how long.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: If that is how you wish it to be, then go ahead and forge the trail. I will follow your path once I have rested a bit.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I see respect in the blurry eyes of the drunkards. I accept.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: You do not know what happened! I must leave now before my anger rises any more.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: One more thing... you will find a wide hall before too long that contains several wands mounted on pedestals. If you walk before these wands, you may be killed.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I am not sure how I came to be here... like you, I suspect. I have been trying to find my way out, but I was wounded in my attempt to do so.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: In the next chamber beyond the one in which we stand, four portals lie. Each of these portals releases a little cackling fiend which tries to kill me.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: In the next chamber beyond the one in which we stand, four portals lie. Each of these portals releases a little cackling fiend which tries to kill me.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Shortly beyond that chamber, there is a hallway that contains several wands mounted in pedestals. They blast all that walk before them.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: In the next chamber, there are four portals. Each of these portals releases little cackling fiends which try to kill me.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Refresh your...? Perhaps you've taken a knock or two to the head.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: At the least, I would say that not remembering me is a symptom of some deeper problem, though I would not rule out a bad attempt at humor on your part.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: By what authority? This is hardly the time to have a leadership debate, especially one that I have never questioned. Not to any serious degree, at least...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Perhaps this place has made you defensive, and I wouldn't blame you in the least, but your suspicions are better directed at strangers, not friends.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And I do not know why I am here either, but I won't stoop to blaming you. Our history defers any suspicions, at least until we are out of immediate danger.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I'm sure we could navel-gaze all day about what brought us here, but it shall certainly prove pointless if we do not remove ourselves from immediate danger.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I know not who has entrapped us here either, but I would rather not find out simply waiting for them to return. We are at a disadvantage in this place.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No, I do not, and I would rather we furthered the investigation at a time that was more in our favor. We have friends to find and, in time, enemies to punish.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We remain in your company as friends more than guardians, and our exploits together have left the land for the better.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We have earned many enemies, but we have dispatched them all. Whoever has trapped us now is certainly powerful to have done this so easily.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: My husband, Khalid, and I have traveled with you for some seasons now, and the places we have seen number too many to name.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I do not know where he is, and it worries me. No doubt he was taken as we were, though it seems we were all meant for different fates.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: From the state of my head, I think I have been drugged, though I have been spared any serious physical mistreatment.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You judge on appearances, but he has performed admirably more than once. Hold your tongue, or at least reserve your quips for someone more likely to be amused.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am Khalid's wife after all, and despite his flaws, he is a good person. Have you someone who will say likewise for you?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I don't know. If you are of sufficient strength, it is possible the cage may be broken. If not, you may have to search for whatever key it might need.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do try to hurry; I wish to be out of here before the owner returns. The ease of our capture suggests it may be beyond our power to resist.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Perhaps you can break these locks? They seem quite strong, though it would not hurt to try. They look a bit odd as well. Perhaps they are magically warded.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Then the key could be anything. Whatever is done, it must be quick. We were captured easily, and I do not want to be here when whoever did it returns.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A well-thought and calculated plan, though I do not recall you being so cold. Perhaps I have had some memory loss myself.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You have returned? Why? Something you need? Or do you wish to elaborate on your plan and once again assert that you are in the dominant position?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Well, I must say I did not expect you to come back.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You quote philosophy like a student who's read half of every book in school. Take your defensive stance as you will; I am sure it will let you sleep at night.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You speak as though your intent is to offend. Do you wish to keep those that would be your friends at arm's length? I wonder why this might be.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Your words echo through these empty halls because they are just as hollow. If you would drive those who would be your friends away, so be it.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: However, I would be careful not to offend everyone you meet. You will need help at some point. You seem predisposed to trouble.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: An apology of a sort, though I will take it with a grain or two of salt. It will take consistent action to prove your intent to me, but I am optimistic.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I see. You are expecting me to be the convenient diversion then? You did not free a friend; you set loose a clay pigeon to draw the arrows of the hunters.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oh! Squirrels, Boo! I know I saw them! Quick, throw nuts!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Do you wish me dour and sour like most others? No, I say not. The animals run and play without care, and I would too... if such a thing would not squish Boo flat.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I am very serious! Boo would not let me shirk my duties! I would not want to shirk anything! No, ma'am, no shirking!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Eh, well... no... but it sounds sharp and painful, and I always reserve such things for freaks that might steal those squirrels' nuts!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Don't make deals with this scum! He won't keep his-mmmph!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You lying son of a mMMPH!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Fight as best you can-I am free of him!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Gllgghh!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No! Blast you filthy bogslimes! Not again!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Oh for crying at the moon, don't prostrate yourself before this weasel. That's all I'm going to stand!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Fight! I am free of him!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You... you...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You... you were pretty quick to give up your equipment.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Are... are you all right?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Well, that was the most stunning display of bravado I have ever had the pleasure of seeing. Could you possibly have stooped any lower?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You IDIOT! Do you realize how easily he could have killed me? That was the most irresponsible thing I have EVER had the misfortune of seeing!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Rest assured I'll not forget that! It's a wonder my head is still attached, or that yours ever was! Stand well back of me; I'm doubly careful from now on!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Regardless, I had thought you made of sterner mettle. I was mistaken, and will not expect as such from ye again.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Good, I am so glad... you IDIOT! What were you thinking? You could have been killed! An arrow can pierce the heart or the eyes while you stand like a pincushion!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Don't you EVER do something that stupid again, you hear me? Not in a thousand seasons! I lost... I lost...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: *ahem*... I lost Khalid... to a pointless death. I'm not going... to lose you too.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Oh, shut up and let's get out of here. We'll... we'll talk later.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Regardless, I really appreciate what you did... what you tried to do. I was worried that I was... I mean, I've already lost... um...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This is... most disturbing. Nature itself curls back from this vileness. Something must be done!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You'll keep your hands to yourself, lowly one, or have them cut off!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What is this? I am not hurt. Boo is not hurt. What is there to be concerned about?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I have all the senses needed to put evil in its place, plus the added bonus of Boo's keen hamster eyes. What else is necessary?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I have been seen by the best and by the worst, and all have learned that Minsc is Minsc is Minsc. I do good things for those that need them; why is there a problem?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do not test me, rogue. I have not the patience for it.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Where goes the stench of evil, so goes the cleansing wind of Minsc and Boo!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Stand your course, armored louts, and state your business in this place! Wait, I know of you!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oh, happy day! You have come to collect Minsc and Boo, and together we shall put our collective boots to our enemies!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Now look what you have done; Boo is all ruffled. Improve your manner, and I shall think upon joining you later.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc and Boo and you! There can be no greater a team in all the realms!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You should go then, small one. The world is as easily accessible to you as one foot placed in front of the other.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You should rub your drunken eyes, then, human sailor. And then avert them, for you are close to offending me.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oh, Boo, I can never return to Rashemen! I am proven unworthy! I am no man, and you are no hamster... we are lost! Oh the sorrow!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Besides, Boo would nae speak for a week if I picked on the tiny. I am not good with words, but I will fight by your side at a hat's drop.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I could not do it, despite my hunt of all things evil. I don't think anyone suspects, but... but I am not the smartest person.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is small, but is more than people believe. Evil will see you the same as Boo, and that will help you. You will make fine paladin, and I am proud to fight alongside.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You have descended to the depths of evil while I watched, and I am at fault for letting it get so far! With our ties severed, I will be free to exact the proper justice! Boo will have your eyes when next we meet.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo does not like goodbyes, but I know we will meet again. Until then, I will seek the small and fuzzy to console Boo. Where do you want to meet up again?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I would sooner jump into a whirlpool than to sit here for endless hours, as you must surely do.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I cannot say. Please, rejoin with me and go there. It is very important.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: If you do not wish to come now, then I will wait for you there. Please, do not take long. This is important. I will be at the Harper Hold in Athkatla.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Good. This will make things easier for every one.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No, no, no, you must go in. I cannot leave here until you agree to do so. Return when you will be more reasonable.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do you also find sensual my disdain for your disgusting manner?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I could set you on fire with more than that, if you truly wish.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The first thing of sense you have said. Now stay out of my way.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That you live in poverty is gratifying, if you must live at all! I would suggest you change your tone. I am not in a mood for giving charity to old slavers!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes? You talking to Minsc?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says such a sphere will not fit into my pocket. If I can't carry it with me, it's just not a good buy.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes indeed. Boo is exceptionally smart for a hamster. Smarter than all the hucksters in Calimshan.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: He mutters occasionally about fellow hamsters that will kill you all, but he is just moody, so don't worry. See how he glares? Shhh, we should leave him be.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I take it I am the one being addressed here?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I would say you are a fool trying to sell something you do not own and a wastrel attempting to take advantage of the innocent.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is because of dirt such as you that I do not like coming to the city. Do not speak to me again, criminal.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Nobody cheats Minsc! If somebody dares to cheat me, they are in for a boot-stomping adjustment to their moral value systems!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Will you help me? We must join together once more, and our fury will be such that bards will run their quills dry! Yes, ink will be scarce where'er we go!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I do not know either. The bars have no lock at all; they are smithed together. I am proud that they feared me enough to imprison me permanently!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I know you will do it! I only travel with heroes!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I can't help it. Freedom is to be mine, and even my permanently welded cell will not deter you! Yes, no lock at all! They feared me that much, and I am proud!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You return! And with the means to rescue me, no doubt! Ho ho! I see hope in your face! Dirt mostly, but hope is there too!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: But you will keep looking, of course! You would never give up, I know this! A hero always succeeds, and a hero never stops short of their goal!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You... have brushed me aside with your words. You won't help... Boo can see it now! You do not intend to cut my chains! You only intend to yank them!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: The bars! They bend and twist with my berserker strength! Minsc and Boo are free! Now you will n... now...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ooh! Ooooh... oh ho, you are a smart one! I understand now! You said what you did just to get me mad! Mad enough to break free! Ha ha! You are as smart as Boo sometimes!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Now we can resume our adventures together! There are friends to avenge and villains to smack about the face and neck! Right, Boo?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What is this? Why do you exhibit such an unpleasant demeanor? What have my people done to deserve such hatred from you?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I lead no one to evil, human. And we elves have reason to be proud... we are an old race, far older than you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are a fool, human, and I've no reason to discuss anything with you further.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I am always willing to help those in need! I will give your troubles the one-two boot-stomp of goodness!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I sometimes feel lost, but Boo tells me where to go. Boo points, I punch! Well, Boo actually just kind of runs, but I still punch! Yes, sir!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo knows everything and is ever so willing to help others. You... you are kind to animals, aren't you? Rodents in particular?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo doesn't like rats either. Something about their tails makes him... edgy, and you don't know creepy until you've seen an edgy hamster!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes, Boo is friend to all. Such greatness, packed into a small, furry bundle of goodness.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Eh? You are speaking of me? How do you know this?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Are... are you speaking of me? And Khalid? How do you know of this? Answer me!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Fellow prisoner that you must be, there is no time for idle chatter. Get you so we can work on getting out. I have to talk to them.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Come on! I'll drag you out of here if I have to, just so long as we get out! I can't go through any more.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Don't look at me like that. It just hurts, all right? Must have been the noise. There was a fight... assassins came after our captor, I think.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No. I do not act. I fight, and fight for real.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You should be careful, woman... you might miss him more than you think should your wish come true.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Not all elves are "flighty"... in their many years, they learn all too well the responsibilities and pitfalls of this world. You would do well to remember that.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I am sorry, little halfling.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Why does this impish halfling jump around me like that? Is he dancing? Boo likes it when halflings dance around!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Have no fear for me, my friend. I am well capable of defending myself... and punishing those who commit such acts on others!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is not the magic that is evil, but the purpose behind it, and the purpose of many magic users is good... something I am sure even you have benefited from somehow.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I think this is good for you. Boo also is sending his congratulations.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I might join your hunt another time, but seabirds make Boo uncomfortable. It is best I spare them his wrath. Yes, best for all! But I must go now, little one.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: N-no, that's quite all right. Do not make a fuss.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Heh...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Well...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What a... charming fellow. Completely insane of course. Out of his mind. Blind as a bat. No idea what he was saying.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Yes. Well.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Let's... let's get going shall we?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The... the locket is lovely, by the way. Thank you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Dermin? What are you doing back here? I am glad to see you; I had thought our friendship...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What are you talking about?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What? Such a thing has never been done!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What do you mean?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Very well, Dermin. I will think on this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Well, that was decidedly unpleasant, and more than I wish to worry about.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Of... of course. It would be senseless. It does put a different light on things though. I will give this much thought indeed.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am going to do exactly what I said I would do. I am going to think about this. All of this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have known him a long time. He was a mentor when I had none. I will think on this a long time. All of this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What are you doing? Why are you here?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: you magnificent bastard! I would kill you for following me if I were not so glad to see you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Is it always about winning? Am I the simple treasure at the end of your trek? Would a golden chalice serve just as well? Or a sword?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Regardless, there are no Harpers here. None that act with sanction, anyway. They have made no effort to hide their motives from me; I was bait for you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We may still be hunted. I must ask Dermin if I see him again. He told me to come here, so I need to know if his allegiance has changed or not.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I wanted to atone with the Harpers, but these are not they. I think revenge is more a factor here. The true Harpers have abandoned this garish place.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Passing by"? Athkatla? I see. Well, thank you for... thank you for following me, even if you are only "passing by."

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Normally they would not allow it, but this place looks deserted by true Harpers since Galvarey's death. I'll wager it was too garish.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Notice the lack of spectral harpists? They were here at one time, and they would not leave their post unless it was no longer to be guarded.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Those we kill in self-defense may look like Harper allies, even if they are not. We have no choice, and I will not feel guilty over this tangled web anymore.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Let's get out of here, but take care: If their tactics are as simple as their motives, then you may have been allowed to pass. Our exit may be treacherous.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am glad too. We will talk later.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have nowhere left to go if not with you. You would leave me here with a likely ambush waiting outside?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Then... then this is goodbye. For all your words, they were right. Goodbye. I will not be seeing you again.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Stop!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do you see him? Ready yourself.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Dermin! I would speak at you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Shut up! I said I would speak AT you! This matter is finished! I will not acknowledge this again! If you press it, I will be forced to deal with you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Yes, actually, and you well know it! Galvarey was no more a Harper than a treant. His actions betrayed him, and all those that followed him!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The garish Hold, his political agenda-he was merely using the weight of the Harper name to promote himself. Tell me: What did he offer you?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Then I am better for it. Call me traitor, but I have followed the spirit of the Harpers. You are the traitor, and if the events were known, others would see!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Of course not. Despite the ambushes, you will still be able to claim the moral high ground for your actions. What happened to you, Dermin? I do not know you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: At the cost of the innocents. That is always the way.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It certainly disrupted you. The innocents also include Harpers that have died thinking they were fighting for the right cause. Galvarey's cause. Your cause.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: As was yours, though I suspect you have been gone for years.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Save it, Dermin. I have no more guilt about facing you or any other sent on this fool's crusade. You are the betrayers, not I. I know this in my heart.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I did not wish to do this. I did not. We are in the right, but why does it still hurt?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Heh, you and your jokes make me smile far too often, even when I do not want to. People will think I am getting soft.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Haha! Shush you! I'm supposed to be feeling bad about this whole thing. Oh, let's just get moving.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: *snicker*

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I've sat through all of your little plots and plans. The least you can do is toss me a bone now and then. Yeesh, take their thunder for one conversation and they gets all touchy.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Let's get out of here. We've still got things to do.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Yes, yes, you do what you can, not always what you want. The Big Little Book of Alaundo, right? Insightful.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am sorry, I shouldn't be taking my anger out on you. Let's just get moving. I'll be all right in a while.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Heh, a wise move. I will not have this situation made trite. I may be in a foul mood for a while, you understand? Yes, I think you do. Thank you.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is no pet... he is a fine companion for Minsc. But he seems to like you anyway.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Are you trying to tell me, bard, that you do not remember us? You were working for that evil sorceress, Silke, when we ran into you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Well, you didn't have many thoughts in your head then, and it is obvious you do not have many now.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Perhaps you should go and soak your head within a bucket, guard, before you attempt to address me again.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Perhaps people just need a swift kick in the punctuals!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No, I seldom have time for reading. Too much work to be done!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Obviously, if I did have a problem, you would be the very last person I would be speaking to, you selfish and close-minded fool.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Why? In beloved Rashemen, if things don't work, we encourage them with a loving backhand of productivity!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: A thinking game! Minsc knows the answer then! Evil ends in death, because I put my foot in its backside!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oops. I apologize.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This is a foolish question! Who travels with you? Minsc does! What else matters?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oops. I apologize. Next time, I let Boo answer.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You Amnian are too closed-minded about the demihuman kin that live amongst you in peace... they are not so different from you as you seem to think.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You certainly are not! And perhaps you should think, sir, before you speak such insults so candidly.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You cannot have Boo, little girl! But you may pet him and make pretty cooing noises if you wishes.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is not food. Maybe I should throw you to the cute little meat-eaters and see how you like it?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Too... weak... I feel the curse within... Damn you, Ployer! I'll be cured yet...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Her cause seems just, and she is druid kin of a sort. Let us do our best to aid.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I will find my own way, and... *cough*... and damned if I won't live to see you die on this path you've chosen. Ah, I will waste no more breath on you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You wish me gone! I- *cough* I shall seek help on my own. A word before I go: Beware your friends. No doubt they will eventually treat you as you treat them.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He was irredeemable when he was on trial. He lives because he "donated" to the state. I will make good use of our next meeting, but not just because of his attack.

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: My queen! you has saved us. Can our trees be saved? Has Irenicus doomed us?

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: Thank you, my queen.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: I thank thee. Go and leave me to oblivion at last. Sweet sleep...

Speaker: Rielev
Text: You are heartless. I again feel hate.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: He's... he's dead now? This pathetic creature...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I can't look away. I have seen death in our scuffles before, but here I did nothing but watch his life end...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I can't look away.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Death is... pretty. Why would I think that? Oh, I've got to get out of this place.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: This poor creature wishes to die? Right here? We should...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: We should help... we should... we should see what happens now!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Oh, all right, but then we have to get going. It isn't safe here.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: We lived at Candlekeep. It was the safest place, what with you having that Bhaal blood. You were with Gorion. I guess I came along later.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I think they let us stay because Gorion had powerful friends. I wish he had said where I was before that, but he thought it wasn't important, so I didn't worry too much.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Gorion was like a father, but I preferred old Winthrop. He was the innkeep, and he taught me about keeping out of sight and such.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: We left when Sarevok killed Gorion. I was sorry I couldn't help, but we got him in the end. Remember that? That Sarevok turned out to be a child of Bhaal, like you?

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Anyway, now we're stuck in this place after getting captured by some creep that has been torturing us! Now, can we please go?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Imoen! Quickly, child, bring you to me. I would have words with them if they is able.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I can help you too. Should I not try? I hate to see you cooped up like that.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Of course, but if you is here as well, I should speak with them.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Minsc, that is horrible! I am so sorry for you.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I won't cry for the dead! I won't! Okay, maybe a little, but I will staunch the flow of tears with righteous fury! Lullaby and goodnight, evil! Minsc will make you pay!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Eww, I... really don't want to think about that too much.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I... I know this room. I've been in here... we both have. He... There are things in these tanks. They used to be people...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: What kind of monster is this guy? Captures us easy as pie, kills whoever he wants... that could have been us in those glass things.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I don't know about that, Minsc, but he sure is a cute little fuzzy wuzzy. Aren't you, Boo?

Speaker: Imoen
Text: We don't even know where we are, and my head is still doing funny things... He said something... something about potential.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Are we? Horrible, horrible things surround us, and my head still hurts like crazy. I want to know what he did to me. I remember... something about potential.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: He said it about you too: something about power that can be unleashed. I don't care; I just have to get out. Can we leave this room? It bothers me.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I want to know what he did to me too. My head still hurts really bad. He said... said something about potential... about you too.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Wow, a golem. Powerful magic stuff. Odd that it's not hostile. I suppose its maker didn't expect us to escape, so it never got orders for restraining us.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: They only do exactly what they are directed to; they don't really think. If it hasn't been told to keep quiet, we might get some information out of it.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: What...? What is this place? It's-it's beautiful! Oh... there is simply no way that this space belongs to the same person that owns those horrible glass containers.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: No, it can't be. Not the person I know. This... this bed, that table... I know of them. He would... he would speak of them while... while he...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: It's for a lost love, kept in perfect condition. She... she despises him. This is his monument to her. He spoke of all of this, but... but his voice was cold...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: No emotion at all, not even remembered. He spoke of these things even while he cut... he cut... and the spells that wove through my brain... cold, ugly things!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: It still hurts... his sick fingers are still in my head, doing whatever it was he started. I see blood... and death... behind my eyes... Irenicus...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: This room: If he could care for anything, he would care for this room. Above the lives of all of us. It makes me sick. I feel... I feel... so much hate.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I would burn this place, but it is nothing. Even as it means so much, it is nothing. Let's do what we must and get out of this place; it is making me sick.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: We are nothing; that's why the golems don't care. Why bother worrying about gnats? Besides, he doesn't need to catch us. I can tell. I can feel it.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Duergar, I think. Kind of evil, I guess, so I'm not surprised they would be working for our captor.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: For the knives, probably. The knives... he has a lot of them... I'm going to have a couple of scars from this... looks like you will too.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I doubt he cares for anything more than the quality of knives they make. He has a lot of them... I'm going to have scars from this... looks like you will too.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Jaheira... I wanna say how sorry I am about Khalid. I... I know this is hard...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No! You do not know. This is not the time for this conversation, child.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Stop calling me "child." I'm as old as you, and besides, I can tell you that Khalid did not suffer.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What are you babbling about, Imoen? I am not in the mood.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I'm not babbling! I saw him do this! Khalid was dead when our captor started... doing those things to him!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You saw this? You watched as it was done?

Speaker: Imoen
Text: He... he showed me. He cut and... and showed me. He forced my eyes open and made me look as he...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Stop, I don't want to hear this.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: He said I should see, so I would understand, but I don't know what he wanted! He would cut and say "Do you see?" Cut and say "Do you see?"

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Be quiet, child! No more!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I am not a child! I'm as old as you, and I've... I've seen. I can see...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You've seen some horrible things best forgotten. We all have, in our day. This will pass when we... avenge the fallen and... bury this son of a bitch.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I see now... in my head... cut, "yes, I see..."

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Imoen! Enough! Let's go!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: So beautiful! I used to dream of dryads and their beautiful trees.

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: You are welcome among us, girl. Youthful exuberance is music that we have not heard in such a long time.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I used to dream... but he doesn't. Your charms don't work on him anymore, do they?

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: How do you know of this? He has touched you as us, hasn't he? Irenicus searches for something he cannot find, and he looks within those that have no more idea than he.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Irenicus...

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: A name that is synonymous with death and ugliness.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: No, death sounds different. He showed me... I spit on his name. I spit on this place.

Speaker: IDRYAD1
Text: Live as you can where you must, young woman. You will not survive if you give in. We have learned this.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I have learned... something different. So beautiful you are. I almost can't see you. I just want to go home. Oh, when can we go home?

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: We are supposed to instill emotion, but he is barren inside. I am not sure what he expects.

Speaker: IDRYAD2
Text: We are supposed to instill emotion, but he is barren inside. I am not sure what he expects.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I've gotta hand it to you... you sure have some kind of courage to sleep in this place. I would've run screaming a dozen times over if you weren't here.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I guess I should be used to sleeping with both eyes open. I don't deal with this well. We're alike because of Gorion, but I prefer being in the background.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This is silly! Buttons are not how one escapes dungeons! I would smash the button and rain beatings liberally down on the wizard for playing such a trick!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: He was a great mage, and supposedly a great adventurer. It's funny; we lived with him for years, and Jaheira seems to know more about him.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I guess he was a big friend of the Harpers. Even got a visit from Khelben "Blackstaff" once. Real powerful mage. Talked to Gorion like an equal.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I wish we could go back to those days, before all this fuss and bother. Before I learned... Well, we've seen so much. Candlekeep seems so small now.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We have done nothing to you. I see that you are an elf... We are prisoners here, as are you. Perhaps if we could-

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Nonsense, he was secretive with everyone. We just had... mutual acquaintances.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Seems like we're not important enough to worry about. I'm just not up to this like you. We're alike because of Gorion, but I prefer being in the background.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Does it? Then I feel better. I figured I didn't deal with this as well as you. We're alike because of Gorion, but I prefer being in the background.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: So... I see we have a name for our captor at last. Irenicus, is it? Tell me, dryads, why this Irenicus would go to such lengths to keep you three here?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Irenicus? There is a special place in my bootprint for him, and I shall fill it in the name of Dynaheir! Such evil to keep forest spirits locked away!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Well, when people are in danger, sure. Winthrop taught me how to get out of trouble, but Gorion always said there are times when it's worth getting into it.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Surely you won't refuse them the chance to return to their forest? It takes no effort from us and would be a kindness to them. Think it over.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Yeah, you're right. I don't want to spend a second more in this place than I have to. My head still hurts, and I keep seeing things in corners and such.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: We won't be able to just walk away, you know. The guy that captured us... he knows about you. He said something about potential, something about great power.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Funny, that. I was sorry to go, but I couldn't let you wander off on your own, now could I? After Gorion d... died, you needed all the help you could get.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Not that I'm much help right now. My head still aches, and I keep seeing things. Too much death around here, everywhere. It's in everything, even me.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: We still had friends there. They were proud, even if they didn't show it. Winthrop said so. He always thought Gorion was too stuffy. I don't know though.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Ooh, my head still hurts, and I keep thinking I see... things in the corners. Too much death here for my liking. It's in everything, even us.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is monstrous that one would do such a thing to a servant, to lock him away in an eternity of pain. It offends nature.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I would hate being forgotten in a bottle. It might depend somewhat on the type of bottle, but overall I expect the effect would be similar. It is not right.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Nature does not intend her creations to live past their allotted time. Certainly not this forgotten servant, tormented and then left for dead, but not dead.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I wonder how this master came to live such a life that he abandons much of it? The fault of ill-considered magic, no doubt. We shall see when we find him.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: What a tortured creature that clone thing was. She was a copy? A copy of another person?

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I wonder why Irenicus made her? I doubt he took pleasure in her company; he's beyond that. He's fascinated with death. He showed me... over and over...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: you will do as they decides is best. While kind enough to give the beggar a coin, there is no need for them to give away everything they owns.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: For shame, that you could speak to a child so. Have you no compassion for the helpless?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We must help this child! I will find who took his mother and teach them a thing or three about decency, respect, and keeping their hands off of people's parents!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Take care. I have heard of these Cowled Wizards. Spellcasters of the highest order, the only magic-users allowed here in Amn, I believe.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Owl wizards?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It is no risk! Not so long as we have swords and braveness to the brim of the tall glass of goodness! Right, Boo?

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Oh... this reminds me so much of Candlekeep. Dusty old tomes all over, bookcases nearly spilling. It's... like we never left...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: But we did, didn't we? I just want to go home again. It doesn't matter where it is, just so long as I can call it home.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Greetings to you, good sir. I trust all is well?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am not here in an official capacity, suspicious one. There is no need to worry.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The gnome is dead. How he was able to perform these great feats of illusion will have to remain a mystery, it seems.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I will protect my witch! EVIL SHALL SUFFER AT THE HANDS OF MINSC AND HIS WITCH! WOE TO THOSE WHO WOULD BRING DANGER TO AERIE!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That was unbecoming of you, to be so forceful with one of such a lesser station. But I suppose you shall do as you wish regardless.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We must aid him! Evil stands before me and demands a quick kick in the posterior!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It sounds like there is a trade of flesh going on, but questioning this man will get us nowhere. Perhaps a more thorough inquiry is called for.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I will not stand and watch men carting slaves! THEY SHALL FEEL MY BLADE AND BOOT AND BACKHAND AS WELL! GO FOR THE EYES, BOO, GO FOR THE EYES!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I doubt this man is a prisoner. More likely a slave, prohibitions notwithstanding. A revolting practice wherever it is carried out.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Hmmm... the sphere is awfully big for only 500 gold pieces. It might be a good bargain. What say you, Boo?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: There is nothing wrong with a noble task duly undertaken. And perhaps it will be enjoyable to see you in a greener setting, dwarf.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I hope you intend to go to this village soon. A visit to greener lands would be welcome after our trek through this crowded city.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We shall go and save the village for the boy! I will crush the evil! All of the evil! Even the small, rodent-sized evil... although that is more Boo's job.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: They throw this man into a pit with a wild beast? This is a crime against man AND nature! They will surely feel my wrath for this travesty!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You may wish to reconsider your refusal. This may be a way to overcome the slavers here for good. It is the honorable path, if you are interested.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We are going to free this warrior and his people? This is a task of great honor! We shall be great heroes for this, heroes doing heroic things for all to see!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc and Boo! You FORGOT Boo!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc and Boo! You FORGOT Boo!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo has many pointers on how to adventure. He is a very wise hamster.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo has many pointers on how to adventure. He is a very wise hamster.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This man is a great evil if he does such things! The shining blades of goodness must be raised against him! Justice demands a painful, pointy thrashing!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do not overly concern yourself with the pursuit of precious metals alone, Korgan. There are other matters that we must consider here.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Ah, a chance to strike at the heart of slavery here in Athkatla. Think of it; you could make a difference, if you wish. At least for a while.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: More children kept as slaves! Boo is outraged by the evil that leaps about this city like a hot-footed weasel! We must save the children, we must!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A thoroughly despicable man... and an equally despicable place. This is the sort of thing that comes naturally with civilization, it seems.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No, he is not. He has no interest in anything you might have to sell, woman.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Druids would not attack a town without cause. It would be a very extreme reaction, and is definitely something we should investigate.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It cannot be! I would sooner tear out my eyes than strike down innocent animals! Well, perhaps only one eye... but do not think me any less incensed!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You will not! I will fight to save each and every creature, dwarf! The forest feeds and nurtures, and I will not hesitate to put a birch up your backside!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Why? I have never heard such head-biting villainy, except perhaps in the larger cities, but what passes for entertainment these days is not for me to decide.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Your strange jest is wearing thin, dwarf. I suggest you sate yourself with chicken in the proper place and time, and leave the woodland creatures as they were.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You will not, Korgan. There is a disturbance in nature that we are to restore... I will not have you swinging about, heedless of the consequences.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You may wish to reconsider, Korgan. Doves can carry several diseases, and I wouldn't wish you vomiting and cramps simply for being an ignorant lout.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You're welcome to try, but you are not the only one trained in martial skill. Remember that in the forest, you are in my domain and at an extreme disadvantage.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You insult you, and you insult Minsc! There will be liberal butt-kicking now!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I thought such childish antics to be above you. But if it makes you feel better, I suppose I cannot stop you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I cannot believe you would partake in such cruelty. I refuse to watch this.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You pay for dogs to fight in this filthy place? You cannot imagine my anger! I shall find properly heroic companions elsewhere if you continue such outrages!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I have suffered a grievous injury and given Boo rather a large fright. Branwen should heal my wounds lest you be left with an orphaned hamster.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I have suffered a grievous injury and given Boo rather a large fright. Branwen should heal my wounds lest you be left with an orphaned hamster.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: A fine sword. A fine SHINY sword! Use it well, for it is surely enchanted. Boo's got an eye for such things.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: A fine sword. A fine SHINY sword! Use it well, for it is surely enchanted. Boo's got an eye for such things.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: So... I see we have a name for our captor at last. Irenicus, is it? Tell me, dryads, why this Irenicus would go to such lengths to keep you three here?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Irenicus? There is a special place in my bootprint for him, and I shall fill it in the name of Dynaheir! Such evil to keep forest spirits locked away here!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Your words baffle, though I am certain some insult has taken place. Keep your distance from this one, Boo. He is definitely unstable.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Those dwarves that attacked us-I read about them when you were skipping out of lessons back in Candlekeep.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What? No, Boo is no glove! Boo is a hamster, and far more than a handful if he wishes, tiny woman!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Get your hands off me! So help me, I'll...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Where are the mirrors, the switches to pull to show where he is hidden...? *sob* Khalid...!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Damn... damn you...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... no.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Damn you! I will have the heart of who has done this! I will tear their blackened heart from their... I will...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Shut up! No more words! Words are nothing!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Stranger! Nobody! I will not hear your words! Leave me!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: A brave man has fallen here, but that is no cause to hurl insults at the living. Here, Boo shall comfort you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No words! No more words! Save your speeches, save your proverbs! The only voice I wish to hear is... is dead! No more! No...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Imbecile! Affront to nature! What do you and your rodent know? What can you know?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Khalid of my heart, let my love... my love guide the way...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Khalid? Silvanus, let him hear my vow... If I must, I shall empty this city of all within to find his killer... So do I swear.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is my wont to do this, and I shall see that it is done properly. If you would assist, more the better. If not, be prepared to stand aside.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Pirate Lord? Such a name does not conjure images of righteous behavior. Stand still a moment and let Boo have a look at you.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo will soon have you figured out. You certainly seem friendlier than I would think a Pirate Lord would be. And where is your peg?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Your peg. A proper pirate has a peg, whether a leg, arm or... uh... some other expendable extremity. And a parrot.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Certainly! As I have my Boo, so too must you have your parrot. Boo likes parrots. They could wrassel.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Little Imoen, it is Minsc. See, here's Boo... Boo, stop that. It's Imoen. Sure she looks a bit... stressed, but it's still her.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I don't know what's wrong. Boo is all jittery. Something is different about Imoen.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: She seems distant. Those are not Imoen's eyes. Not the one we knew, anyway.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: An excellent warning, if vague. I shall think on your words, though I doubt I shall alter my course. What will come will come.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oooh! This is most goodness of news, is it not, Boo?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo needs to know, did you want us to remain with the group?

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Something strange up here. Be careful, this place has all manner of dangerous devices in it. I don't know what they do, but I know we would be safer if we shut them off.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: We should look in that room to the west first, west and just a bit north. I think I saw some weapons in there. It's a room off the corner of this one.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Do you smell that? Smells like lightning, but indoors? That can't be right. I think I remember. Look to the right... the machine making the storm...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Shall we travel as before?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Then I will go to the Harper Hold in Athkatla. Much must be done to make people respect the reputation of the Harpers again. I will be there if you seek me.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Then I take my leave. I do not like the way you have been leaning lately, and no doubt we would have eventually fought. I bid you farewell.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Have you no sense of charity, dwarf? What is the sense of freeing such children only to subject them to starvation and destitution, then?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Really, couldn't you have spared a little gold for the child? You may have rescued them only to subject them to starvation and worse.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And one wonders how long you have been able to hide your arrogance and disregard behind a semblance of honor, Anomen. Helm would disapprove, I think.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I do not fear you, knight! Any moment you wish to meet on the field of battle, I will be there!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It comes as no surprise to me that an immoral dwarf such as you has a heart of stone, Korgan. I simply expect better from you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That you did, but there is a responsibility that comes with such actions as well. You might decide to ponder that at some point in the future.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What? They have no shame in trading lives of others? Evil, meet my trusty sword! Sword: MEET EVIL!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: How sad, to have been kept prisoner in such a state. And by what? The presence in the sword? It does not make sense.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A puzzle, obviously. We must find the four things spoken of to unlock whatever mystery is hidden here. Who would hide something in such a fashion, I wonder?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ooh! To take swords against monsters of great evil! Already I feel Boo wriggling in excited anticipation!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Of course it is Boo. Boo is always happy when opportunities for heroism come! We shall crush these ogres, and rangers and hamsters everywhere shall rejoice!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I think it would be an excellent idea to get outside of the city and administer justice on such evil creatures. Tyranny is best matched with equal force.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I've fought many an ogre in the past, dwarf, and many other powerful evil creatures aside from such. You should be wary that I do not add you to the list.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Ah, Gorion once said that he and some Harpers dealt a humiliating blow to a dragon in the Stormhorn Mountains. I was not aware this was the same one.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I... would strike for goodness... but this dragon is so... so... It would not be cowardice to come back another day with bigger swords!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am sure you have your reasons, but be not quick to turn down an offer of sanctuary. I am not eager to battle paladins without need.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: we must find this fiend who steals children and disguises knights as monsters and apply a butt-kicking for goodness! All must be avenged!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Indeed. They seek your agreement before telling you what they wish you to do. The Cowled Wizards are not to be trusted, as you well know.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: While surely all murderers must be brought to task, I wonder what manner of justice the Cowled Wizards would apply. It is something to consider.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This changes everything! A fellow ranger plunged into peril by evil wizards! Even Boo cringes at what we have been sent to do! this cannot be!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: A fellow brother of the woods! Is this the man the wizards have sent us to kill? tell me it is not so!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You... you would not lead Boo and me astray! We do good things; we are heroes! This man lies, I say, and I shall fight with you!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! I will not allow you to kill a fellow brother of the woods! You have become evil, and I have allowed it to happen! No longer will I stand by!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We will have to be careful with the Cowled Wizards now at our heels. But it is a righteous cause, and another companion to stand at our side is always welcome.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Be welcome, brother of the woods! Together, you and Boo and I shall stride forward to crush all evil in our wake! Woe betide evil!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And well you should be. This is coward's work, despicable to the core.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are mistaken. I do not bear that name, and I will not. The greater balance bids me here.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are lucky we did not allow the creatures to complete what they started. You are a fool, merchant, and should think with your head instead of your purse.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I think I should like to walk through this place when we no longer need anything from the devil we know.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Me? No, Boo would never allow such a thing! My sword is meant only for being firmly planted in the heart of evil!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... I am not always frowning, I... oh, go away, child. Why are the children of this city so annoying?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: WHERE? Where is there a rat? Oh, you have frightened Boo with your screeching. Calm yourself, Boo. See? We are leaving the loud woman.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Hmm... wait one moment... do I know you?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I see. A Zhentish agent, if I recall, but one of no consequence. Pay him no heed.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: *sniff* Ahh, even Boo cringes from such a foul odor. Surely this instrument will never make beautiful music again.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Ah, yes. The infamous capacity for drow compassion is revealed once again. Ignore her, and let us get this task over with quickly.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Ah, Berinvar is not a Harper, but I certainly am. Will you treat my guests as friends and answer? I assume the guardians are spectral harpists?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: They... they attack this funny man? Why? This evil must be stopped with generous doses of sword-swinging! Come, Boo, we go for the eyes!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He and the others seem preoccupied with the trinkets around their necks. I find it odd I have not heard of this before now. Harpers do not often wear symbols to make themselves *more* noticeable.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This person makes me ill. I suggest we move on before I ignore the greater balance and return him to the dust.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No doubt you have plied your trade on good folk as well in the past. Your balance will come in the end. Nothing goes unpunished.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Heroes of goodness need no warning! Where we tread, evil trembles in our wake!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The confines of the city do much to chisel at the sanity of its inhabitants, but I wonder if there is some other force at work. We had best be wary.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I would rather have given a sword. Give a man a fish and he eats for a day, but teach a man to fight and he can chow down on the meaty marrow of evil!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I'm not sure the lieutenant should go alone. We have evidence of the culprit, but we know nothing of his ability. There may be danger we are not aware of.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: His work? What does he speak of? Quickly, we must stop him before he escapes!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Wha-aat? This is the evil man who steals skins? He must be stopped! He must be stopped, or all who have skins will sleep in fear!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We shall answer your attack, though even Boo sees no sense in it!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This... this place smells heavily of death, and the evidence of it is all around us. Step carefully, for I believe we enter the workshop sanctum of a madman.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have little doubt, that we will also find Lieutenant Aegisfield somewhere herein... Hopefully, the man is still alive.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I understand none of this, but if the one who killed Dynaheir is beyond, Boo and Minsc will make short work of you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are mistaken, but I care not! Khalid will be avenged whether you stand aside willingly or not!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Get out of my way! I don't want to fight any of you; I just want to leave!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I should think not! Child, surely you are better than this? Are you certain of this choice?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That was unnecessarily harsh. I can see that we shall be at odds more often than not, drow.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Such a lack of compassion is unseemly for a knight. Would you have others judge you as quickly?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: One should not turn away an offered hand so quickly, but I would be wary of its secretive origin. Perhaps we can find Imoen on our own.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We don't need money to find Imoen! We are heroes! We will crush wizard after wizard to find her! Hmm, we should start soon if we hope to be done by dinner...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Shadow Thieves? Perhaps we shall finally get answers as to their interest in us.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: My own Harpers have used us. I should have suspected... the gaudy necklaces, the invitation. Ah well. If Xzar was doing as she said, he deserved his fate.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I remember you! And so does Boo! A craven wizard who travels with his untrustworthy halfling!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I was wondering when you would turn up, Zhent. I had suspected our parting would not be permanent when last we met, and it appears my suspicions were correct.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Be wary, the Harpers will not brook interference lightly, and this Zhent likely holds only the worst of intentions in his heart.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Well, if you wish to investigate what has happened to the spy, that is up to you. I suggest caution and perhaps some common sense.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: If the Harpers will even speak to us, which I doubt, they certainly will not reveal what they did with the halfling. Best not to ask about him directly.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is good that this is the final of these tasks set for us. I've no taste for bounty hunting, but let us find this thief and have the deed done with quickly.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Yes, this is an odd structure for the Harpers to erect. I have never heard of an opulent base such as this. Secrecy has always been the watchword before.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am a Harper, Meronia. May I be allowed to speak to these guardians? I assume they are spectral harpists. Perhaps they could satisfy my... curiosity.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oh, I never step on toes... except by accident, maybe. If Boo had me step on toes for real, toes would gloriously be flying everywhere in the wake of my sword!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Yes... I've noticed the amulets you wear. I've heard of the Harper pins, but nothing of these. Is this a local custom?

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: There you are, I see. Why do you continue? You are dead inside already. Irenicus has seen to it. I am left to finish your physical shell.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Bring your wrath to bear if you are so sure. I doubt you will outlive the tenday regardless! I will not bother with excuses; I cannot fight his spells.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: No redemptions, no second chances! Let us get this over with! I stride into the hell that Irenicus promised! Ilmater take my heart, I have no choice!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You shall be called what you are! You are an enemy of fair, departed Dynaheir and therefore an enemy of mine! You shall be destroyed for the good of all!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You will not speak of sweet Dynaheir in this fashion! Terrible hamster justice will be wreaked upon you! GO FOR THE EYES, BOO, GO-

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I... no. No, our cause must not be disrupted. Righteous fury will wait for now, but one day the wizard shall pay for his words with blood! So swears Minsc!

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I did not spend so much time in you's company just to have them killed. That could have been done a dozen times over.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Your memory is selective, Red Wizard. Why do you now work with Shadow Thieves, and what is your connection to our capture by Irenicus? Khalid is dead, and I will have an answer!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: My anger can only barely be contained! Speak to us as if we are anything but heroes, wizard, and you shall be receiving the rented-mule beating you deserve!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Dynaheir's enemy comes with us? Please, say it will not be so! And if it is so, let it be brief! Boo shakes with such anger I cannot blame him!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: How about conscience, dwarf? Or morality? Perhaps you knows what is best.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do not make us laugh, thief master. We have heard of your guild war. You would not approach outsiders if your own house were strong and solid, hm?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You would abandon Imoen here? I would rather leave myself than have you cast her away in this place. It is not right.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We do the bidding of thieves now? Ehhh... this churns my belly like a hamster running endlessly within a wheel. This can't be a good sign.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Rashemen is my home, but I haven't seen it for many moons. I am on my dajemma. I... failed my last witch... but nothing will happen to Aerie! Nothing!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No, it will not be! let Minsc and Boo take their chances here. Do not abandon Imoen to this place.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Poisoned and dying! The tragedy of it sings in my skull! We must hurry and deliver this man to safe harbor!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You would leave a person in obvious distress to his own devices? I would have expected better of you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: But it is the truth, is it not? I am a Harper myself, and we simply wish to be treated as guests. you did bring you your poisoned friend, after all.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That was foolish! The Harpers could have helped you. *sigh* But I suppose you will do as you always have, stubborn person.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am a Harper, friend, and I think I see where this is heading... Is all this really necessary?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: *sigh* If the Harpers have asked this task to judge your worthiness, then there is no way around it. Let us proceed and be done with these "creatures."

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Hmm, I am surprised they are letting us in, even after all this. I warn you, be polite. Our reason for being here is questionable enough as it is.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Hmmm... it's nice to know there's a "softer" and "sweeter" side to you... "Eddie."

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And all feared the Slayer, for it walked like a mortal, but in its wake there came murder, and in the future, there was death.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This is a dark place to meet this woman, and I sense an unnaturalness about her that is disturbing to me. Step carefully.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: How does she know of our link to the Shadow Thieves? And what would they think of this meeting? Be careful, our lives may hang in the balance.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Such an offer from this woman sends chills up and down my spine like angry weasels... but you will know what to do. Even Boo is confident of this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Boldly said, creature, yet you do not face us. you has been underestimated by far better. You will rue the day of conflict when it comes, I think.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It is an option that bears no questioning! you is a champion of good, just as we all are! Always must we take the choice of righteousness!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! Tell me this is not so! No heroes would commit such an act! I could never look Boo in the eyes again if I took part in such a thing!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: My hamster's heart is crushed that you have fallen so far! How could this be? It is my fault, all mine, for letting it happen!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I... I must leave to drown in my sorrows. If you pick yourself up, I shall be in that Copper Coronet. It seemed like a grand place for adventure, oh yes!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This is more like it! A rescue from the hostage-takers! All shall quiver in the wake of our righteous fury! Yes, Boo, show them how they will quiver!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We will charge into the midst of the den of thieves and fling them about like pancakes! All that is glory shall be ours! And then breakfast.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Those who bury the living must be buried by our righteous fury! Woe betide those who would flout justice! So says Minsc, though "betide" was Boo's word.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Step slowly, you do not look well at all. How do you feel?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You would keep this woman a prisoner? Boo is not convinced that this is right. I agree that it smells of evil. Bad you! Bad!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: So the woman is freed? What need is there to collect a reward from the man? Are we not heroes, you and Boo and I? This is most confusing.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You have your money, but you could have avoided the inevitable reputation of a kidnapper. Sometimes I think you act without due consideration.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Are you well? I am growing very worried about you, you know. I should not like to lose you in this evil place.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Your lips move, but there is no sound. you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Nature is not so vindictive, fool. It cares not who prostrates before it, it cares only that the balance is maintained.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This is the hilt of a long sword. It appears to have been forged by a fine craftsman, even though the blade was broken off long ago and the pommel is obviously missing a large gem. STATISTICS: Weight: 2

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It is more dangerous to call Boo a vermin, as he may leap upon you and show you his true warrior spirit. Nothing can contend with the might of an angry hamster!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You would have killed me if I had let you. You would have left me to rot in this place.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I'm not sure you should try to control it. We must distance you from it, not embrace it. We will make do despite the danger.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No, you should not be alone during this. We will get through, I am sure. We just have to keep going, no matter what comes.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are not the only one affected by this! It is so hard to see you...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: please, let's just keep moving. We'll get through, I'm sure of it. Really.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Are you well? It would only be fitting to take some time to rest. You have been through quite an ordeal.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Very well, but keep me apprised of your condition. Imoen supposedly went through the same ritual, but she did not seem to suffer from sudden attacks like that.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That is troubling. I do not know what effect having the ritual had on you, but it does appear to be different from what Imoen suffered. Odd.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am glad that you have chosen this course. This cult stinks of wrongness, an affront against nature that must be stopped!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: An assault on the most foul and evil of creatures! Such a victory shall make us heroes to be sung of throughout the land! Glory will be ours, oh yes!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You align yourself with a temple that threatens its followers? You would bow down before a vindictive god? You are strange indeed.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: The priest turns on us! For shame! Boo will gnaw on his eye sockets for this travesty!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Hold, do not be foolish! You there... how can we be certain of your innocence? Why are you here if you are no longer members of the cult?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We are stopping now? Why are we stopping? We are heroes, and heroes must face the final enemy and win over all!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This... this is the same child-killing gnome from Baldur's Gate! I remember! For the greater balance, his head must be brought to the authorities!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo remembers! Baldur's Gate! Neb the child murderer! You die, gnome, you die! RAAAAAGGGGGHHHH!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... I understand. It is an avatar of a faded god, left guarding an item that has waned in power. Loathing has replaced the worship of his followers. A lingering fate.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Tiny has met a god before this?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is my stalwart companion, and he says that if you must wear the skins of a dead animal around your neck, the evil sharp-toothed weasel is a good choice.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc and Boo fight with swords and teeth for goodness, not for countries. We are heroes, not soldiers, funny man.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: He attacks? Such a display of wrongness fills even Boo with disgust! For my hamster, I must land a blow for goodness!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have no love for drow, or for this drow in particular... but it seems that she has done nothing to deserve this fate other than simply be a drow. This is not justice.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: They... they will not burn the pretty elf? There must be no burning if she has committed no crime! This is not justice! we stop this travesty!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Is that what you see as justice? I sensed great sadness behind her darkness. With balance, she might have been... well, who knows?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We do not rescue her? What was her crime? Maybe darker elves are not all good, but surely not all are totally evil? I am... confused. What does Boo think?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Truth be known, I am not opposed to having Viconia travel with us. Remember, though, that many will think less of us simply because she is here.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We have saved her, and she is our responsibility. What if she was captured again? Neither Boo nor I could live with ourselves. No, she must come.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Are you... yourself? That was... the Slayer! You became a form of the avatar of Bhaal... but the god is dead...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: this is not right at all.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: we had best move quickly! The mages you have let loose will need direction, or they will be impossible to control.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is worried that these inmates will harm themselves. We should see that they are safe and make sure they each have a hamster of their own.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: That last part was my idea.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We must be subservient. To them, we are lesser drow and no doubt under suspicion. Any sign of disobedience would bring scrutiny upon us.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The drow have a harsh culture, one I am not overly familiar with. We must harden our hearts if we are to blend in. The alternative is discovery and death.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Just what are you on to? You think I am blind, not to see your foolish behavior with the drow woman? Why would you play such an idiotic game...? Do you not remember our situation?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Jealous of a simple drow that turns her eyes up at you? Is your opinion of me so low? I merely think that flirtations will gain nothing and endanger us all.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is a foolish one. Drow enjoy neither affection nor intense attraction. Sex is nothing but a game to them. To indulge would be... disappointing.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Oh? I am disappointed. Indulge your carnality, by all means, if it means so much to you. I shall say no more on that subject or any other.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You spent quite some time in the drow woman's chambers. Care to elaborate what you were about, as if I did not know?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I suppose that is true enough, although I can think of several lies you might have tried for our sake. But I trust you enough. Let us just... move on.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Hmph. You are just the sort to lie to me about this. And that this makes me uncomfortable is even worse. I think I prefer to be on my own for a time.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I know the purpose. Simple self-gratification, or do you maintain there was no way to avoid the situation? Ahhh, enough... I do not want to hear any more.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am sorry too, and disappointed, but I suppose it could not be avoided... with you being male and in this guise. I shall... attempt to forget about it.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No? Very well. I shall endeavor to keep my shrewish opinions to myself, on this and all other matters regarding us.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Hmmm... out so soon? Did the drow woman not dig her claws into you successfully? That is good. I shudder to think what might have happened otherwise.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: True heroes demand no reward, and Boo knows you to be a true hero! We need only know what foes we are to face before the boot-stomping can begin!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: How can you refuse so coldly? I will not stand idly by. Nalia... we will aid you, as will you, I am sure. What is the problem, precisely?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! Say it cannot be so! we must rescue the nice man's child and be off! Unless... unless you have some plan? Minsc is confused.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! Has you truly fallen so far? A glorious rescue has turned into a nightmare of epic proportion! Minsc and Boo will stop you!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo knows! Do not stow thrones in grass houses!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: The evil wizard is dead! Once again, Boo and Minsc and you emerge as victorious heroes! Much rejoicing and celebrating must be commencing soon!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A bitter end to a terrible man. We did well, I think, but I am not certain that all has been restored to as it was. Do you feel any different?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oh, such a glorious death in battle for Minsc and Boo! We were well on our way to the great fields and halls of Rashemen, but we felt you needing us, so we came!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It... it is not finished, is it? This is death... and your strange power has dragged me here with you....So be it then. We stand together until the end.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I understand plenty already! This place reeks of corruption and deceit!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This young minstrel has lost his wits and his songs? Minds are common enough, but tunes of merit are few and far between.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Rest, child. None of this group shall harm you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Oh? Is that what those retching noises were? I thought that perhaps there was a wounded seal somewhere onboard giving birth.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Okay, I'm not quite so concerned about this little freak. Rule as you will, little tyrant, just as long as it is from a cell.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes! Such fire and conviction! A pity there are no actual enemies to warrant the screaming, but good show anyway. Boo applauds!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It is okay to come out now, Boo. The pale woman is gone. You can stop shivering too. You are a warrior hamster, so be brave! Brave!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I suppose we could expect no less from a simple pirate. Begone with you then, scoundrel. No doubt you would only bring us more trouble here than we need.

Speaker: Minsc
