Text: All good peoples hang their head in shame! We are betrayed! The sailor man brings the vampires back amongst us... there shall be a mighty reckoning for this!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: These are the same creatures we fought when we entered the lair of the vampire that was aligned against your own guild. Bodhi must be nearby indeed.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I do not think Boo is too thrilled about you borrowing his face. He only has the one. You don't hurt those you mirror, do you?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do you spend all your time in the guise of others, child? Do you not take solace in the balance of your true self?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: War? War amongst the elves? What could that mean? How could even Irenicus start such a thing? That would bring nothing but ruin!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: As much as I should not trust his advice, he may have a point. There are powerful mages above who may be the difference between life and death.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ughh, my head spins. So many quick words from so many small sources. Countersong, Boo. Relax my frazzled nerves.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What does everyone stare at? Boo's churring calms me down. See?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes! Revenge! Revenge for precious Dynaheir! Tremble, wizard, for the mighty Boo will have your eyes! RAAAARRRRGHH!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What revenge do *you* have, wizard? You killed my Khalid with no more thought than one would give to a fly! I shall have *my* revenge! Nature's fury shall strike you down!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: That's a much shorter interjection than Boo has become used to, Jan. Are you ill?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You think us fools? You knew your ship was scuttled when you first spoke to us, didn't you? You seek to use us somehow!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: She sees the universe unrestricted. It is amazing that she manages to be as lucid as she is.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And what would you have to do with that, Edwin? Perhaps if ego were all that was required.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! No collar! I will not be collared by the smelly fishmen! My warrior spirit will not bear such a thing!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I should have known. Once again your peculiar destiny has drawn us into something. Even the shark gods flounder in anticipation of your arrival.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo too has small teeth compared to fish-men. But they hurt just the same when they latch onto the eyes, yes sir!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have never known you to be so judgmental, paladin. Surely you do not label all sahuagin so? Condemn them all to death and you are no better than they.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Must it come to slaughter, sahuagin? Your priestesses speak of your entire people needing your blood... Have you attempted to resolve this with the king peacefully?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: My skin may not have scales, but it has seen many suns come and go. Boo thinks you could use some sun too. Then you might not smell so much like wet laundry.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Well, Viconia. It would seem you carry less weight than you thought. He questions your worth, rightfully so.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Don't worry, Aerie. I'm here to protect my witch. Boo too, though I think he would leap to protect anyone in distress. It's his heroic nature, you know.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A most underhanded maneuver. Although I am sure it is no less than Phaere might have planned for us. There is an ironic justice in this, no?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo bristles at his words. I don't know the language, but he is insulting us for certain!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: So... a war? Open battle between the drow and the surface has not occurred in... eons. With a greater demon to back them... I truly wonder why Irenicus would do this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You would commit such a sacrilege against nature? Had I known, I would never have accompanied you! No, I will not let this be!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I cannot believe my ears! You would stand against all that is good and right? You shall suffer a terrible vengeance for this!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: As much as I despise this form, it does seem to have captivated our friend here. He seems fearful.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes! Hello! Minsc is a drow! And Boo is a shadow hamster!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Despite what she says, we may be able to use this situation to our advantage. Perhaps there is no need to kill Solaufein. Consider this, at least.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Drow roaming the surface, even the most noble, should expect an occasional misunderstanding. I am sure this can be worked out... I suggest you try.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This drow is well respected by the Harpers. I will not assist you fighting him. I will return to Athkatla; consider your idiocy before we speak again.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Another drow who speaks strange words! Even Boo bristles at his obvious lies! If you fights, then so does Minsc! Prepare for liberal butt-kickings!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: An excellent idea. Adding Drizzt and his companions to our battle against Bodhi will certainly tip the scales. You show great wisdom.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I know of this one, from the Harpers. A drow of good alignment and heroic reputation. He is deserving of respect.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ooh, another drow! I begin to see them everywhere, ever since the Underdark! They are so vicious even Boo cowers. What will we do?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I do not cause trouble! I merely seek it out and put the bootheels of justice to it! Ask Boo!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A fine sentiment, Cernd, though we may be forced into more trouble than we wish.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is impressed, Korgan. You remember well to act like drow.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That was close. We must make an effort to act as we appear.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The Seldarine? The collection of elven gods led by Corellon Larethian? How would he ever propose to join such ranks? Mad! Mad!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Your soul is borrowed, and it shall be returned. You are a blight upon nature, and you shall be destroyed!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: For Dynaheir and all fallen comrades, for what is good and right, for all these things shall Minsc and Boo fall upon you today! And we shall taste victory, evil man!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Edwin, in some another time... some other place, such a comment would get you a beating of mythic proportions. It may yet.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Neither do we, right, Boo?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What's so funny?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No more platitudes, Irenicus. You have taken much from all of us. Now you die your final death!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I grow tired of shouting battle cries when fighting this mage. Boo will finish his eyeballs once and for all so he does not rise again! Evil, meet my sword! SWORD, MEET EVIL!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Worry not, Viconia! Minsc and Boo stand at the ready to protect! Right, Boo?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! You will not attack the small dark ones! Minsc and Boo will not allow it! And I hope no other will either!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I will not let you do this! You will not murder those that beg for aid! Who will follow me?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: And then Minsc will disrupt them with his bootheel! Yes, speak more of this evil-smashing partnership!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It would appear that neither of us have much of a choice in the matter. We must trust one another.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Of course, my Lady Adalon. do keep quiet.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is unfortunate that they did not offend you in some way. We might have been spared the headache of this journey if they had to face an angry silver.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo shakes with disbelief! Such a crime will not go unanswered!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: To become such a hated thing... I do not look forward to that.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You should have made more of an effort. We have an obligation to destroy you, as if we needed more reasons.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo would have found her wherever she tried to put her evil foot! That's what we do!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Irenicus is the most vile of villains if he dared destroy a whole city! I can't believe that, and I have believed some amazing things, let me tell you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Knock him on the head? It is obvious this lout has no compassion for others and no inclination of how nature must be protected. Ignore him.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: you can't seriously consider poisoning this font. If there is evil there, we must cleanse it. To destroy it is sacrilege! I will not allow it!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Groves are wonderful... you wouldn't really poison one, would you? Boo suggests that perhaps you are tricking this evil little man. Smart thinking, I agree.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No, no! This is evil! You poison nature itself! I shall not partake in this... who stands with me?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This is the evil killer who takes skins that do not belong to him! We have discovered him! We must take the bootheel to his ways!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: These people are slaves, mentally as well as physically, controlled despite themselves. All we can offer them, unfortunately, is a quick death.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: There are many who easily sidestep laws through wealth. Perhaps, in this case, it would be best to see why the law has failed so.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: To decide between justice and honor! Oh, it is a conundrum that would tie even Boo up in knots. I do not envy you. My decisions are usually easier than this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The law may not be able to do anything, Anomen, but such men as this Saerk always trip over their own schemes. If he is responsible, he will pay, as you say.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Too many of the wealthy escape justice, yes. If you are sure that Saerk is responsible for the death of your sister, then we must ensure he pays dearly!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: By... by the gods! You foolish man! Can you say that this young woman was a murderer as well? You have murdered an innocent!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! Minsc did not come here to kill young girls! You cannot tell us that the young girl was anything but innocent! This is not right!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have the feeling we are intruding on a very private matter. I feel uncomfortable with our intrusion; perhaps we should leave...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A fair line easily used by servants of the wizard themselves. We have been imprisoned and worse, and given many reasons to distrust strangers we encounter.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We serve no evil mages, no sir! But Boo looks upon you with suspicion, little man. How is it you come to be here? Never have I seen Boo's whiskers quiver so!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Athkatla? That's... the City of Coin, right? A merchant city in Amn. We come from the Sword Coast, a ways to the north. Why do you think we're in Athkatla?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Then you too know the hardship of being set into a maze like a helpless hamster! We are comrades in peril! Boo asks what you propose we do next, little man.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You have extorted a payment from Raelis in return for our help. I do not agree with this decision... it smacks of selfish greed.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What is this? Minsc and Boo were just getting into this wonderful story when it was sadly interrupted. A work of mastery, this is!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We must be calm. Vengeance will only bring conflict with the guard. To help Nalia, we must prove that our cause is just... there is no other way.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Someone has rattled the little one's brains? Hmm, I know how she feels. If this was done on purpose, he deserves a mighty kick in his posterior at the least!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A mind flayer? Here? A spy perhaps, using its psionic powers to keep its secret. Strange that Jan's mad uncle should be aware of its presence.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Helping others is good! What a nice little girl you are. Would you like to see my Boo? I think he approves of you too.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Helping others is good! What a nice little girl you are. Would you like to see my Boo? I think he approves of you too.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You speak as if unaware of class distinction, and yet your manner exudes it. A sign of immaturity... perhaps adventuring is not the place for you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You speak as if unaware of class distinction, and yet your manner exudes it. A sign of immaturity... good, then, that you is sending you ahead.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You dare reprimand those who have died defending you? Even now they strive to protect you from evil you don't even understand! You could have been dead!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have no fear for his well-being, monster.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You have saved me, and I am in your debt once more. I am... I am glad you risked so much to come for me.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I see. Very well, I shall be on my guard. Do we continue now? There are more important things to do than sit here talking about things that... don't matter.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Very well. Let's waste no more time.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... I would say as much about you. I will stand at your side as long as I am able... if you will have me there and return the favor.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I shall enjoy some quiet time once this is done. We have had very little time to speak...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I'm sorry, I should not be so swept up in this. Let's go.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I don't wish to alarm you, but Boo is absolutely fretting about your condition. Are you well? Fear in Boo is uncommon, and usually weasel-caused.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We can rest if you wish. I do not understand what Irenicus did, but Boo has said that it was traumatic, and I will guard if we must stay here a while.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: That is good. I will guard if you need to rest. It is the least I can do, since I could not stop Irenicus.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Then Minsc and Boo will turn their attentions to more important things, like staying alive. We should get moving if you are through with your headache.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: There's people dead all over, and the fighting is still going on. I could hear it. Are you going to get moving, or do I leave without you?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Where? Where exactly is it being put to good use? We are not to be played with, Linvail. I should like to see results, and I should like to see them soon.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo does not think so, despite your kind words. You smell of treachery. Prove me wrong or face the boot!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You'd have bought a trip to the graveyard if you had spent the money we needed to rescue Imoen! Minsc and Boo would see to that!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Oh, how generous. Do you expect that to compensate while you delay our more important concerns? We have friends in need of rescue and vengeance both!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And vengeance!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I see. You must be the rogue, Jarlaxle, that was mentioned to us, yes?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A poor thing. We could have done better by these people with minimal effort. It is a better fate than what the drow had in store, however.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No. "Veldrin" would not be interested in such diversions, male. I... as a female, I command you to stand away from him. Slug.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: When all others stand numb, it falls to Minsc and Boo to make comment. you...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo just soiled my backpack.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo does not favor the odds, but I have no doubt we will succeed!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Yes, declare your loyalty, Viconia. When you eventually betray us, I will hold your statement up as proof of the untrustworthy nature of your kind.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo would have sensed any treachery long ago! She fights well with us!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Cernd, I would normally bow to your wisdom, but in this matter, I think you are... mistaken. I make no protest; I merely wish to state my opinion.

Speaker: IDRYAD3
Text: May the forest always open a path for you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We are bought off yet again. I do not deny that they are the best chance we have to find our quarry, but we had best do their little chores quickly.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Thank you for your opinion, Korgan. I'll just place it over here where it can collect flies all on its own.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo concurs! We must hurry and dispense with this errandry so we can get to the fighting of greater evils more worthy of my bootprint!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc and Boo will protect your street, Aerie! You will cross it for your pleasure, not for fear of it!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You baffle me sometimes, Cernd, but I bow to your wisdom on this matter.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Then let us get going! Boo and I have several talents we will unleash upon it!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Not just thieves, but traitorous thieves. Our associations sink ever lower in Aran's service. Let's get this over with.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have heard some in the Harpers speak of it. It is more than a prison or supposed asylum; it is a place to forget people that are "troublesome."

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Long ago, I promised to assist you if your adopted father fell. That promise has not expired, nor has your worthiness. I stand with you if you will have me.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc owes much to the killer of Dynaheir! I stand with you! Nowhere shall I go until the heel of justice has been firmly imprinted once and for all into the wizard's evil backside! Nowhere!

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I can't fight it, I can't. I was in his service first, and all those that follow him must undergo a geas. I was willing at the time... but now...

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Do you... do you know what happens when you try to defy a geas? It hurts... It hurts and then you die. His spells are powerful, so powerful.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I believe it does... I can wither and die for failing to kill you, or I can fall in battle and pray that my heart will find purchase with Ilmater.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Yes, yes, you can. I have but two options. A slow and painful death for failing to kill you, or a swift one in battle, and may my heart find purchase with Ilmater for these sins.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is not necessary to say anything. I know what comes next... I know what may happen. To either of us.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We have been through too much to let that stop what you must do. For all the pain that losing Khalid brought... I would not give up our years of good works.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Let us regain your soul and make you whole again. And what comes after... comes after. I look forward to it... should the gods prove willing.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: say we won't look back. I don't care if he can "tap the power" or access whatever avatar stuff. We've gotta get away from all this death.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Means a lot to hear that. I can't stand all these shadows...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I appreciate that, but I doubt he meant you any good either. Didn't spare you the knives any more than me. Come on, I gotta get away from all these shadows.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Let it go, please? Whoever he is and whatever he can do, above it all, he's a vile bastard that's hurt us both. Come on, I gotta get away from all this death.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: He said something like "releasing power within you so it could be used," but if it means taking part in horrible things... I don't like this place. Can we go?

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I don't care if he could make us three ogres strong, I have to get out of this place. It bothers me. Makes me think I see... things.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: As if I need another reminder. I don't care what power this guy thinks he can tap in you, he's just sick to the core. We can't ever look back.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No, Valygar, we shall not give up on you. The Cowled Wizards believe much if they think to use everyone as they wish. You will receive nothing this day, mage!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! We do not abandon comrades! Never could I look Boo in the face again after such a thing! We shall give the evil wizard a certain boot-kicking instead!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You will hear the name "traitor" many more times today, Yoshimo, but let me be the first among the group to spit it at you!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: A slap in the face of our trust! A sword to the heart of our confidence! A boot to the prunes of our friendship! Perhaps I go too far, but Boo is absolutely incensed!

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Don't make this harder than it already is. I can't help you. There are circumstances that you are not aware of.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Yes, yes, it is the coward's way out. What of it? What choice do I have when the alternative is death, no matter where I go or what I do?

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I would not deliver a friend to a devil for mere coin! I had... no choice! Death would be my payment if I failed, no matter where I went or what I did!

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Death! Death no matter where I would go or what I would do! That is what awaited me if I failed. Can you understand that?

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: My service was promised long before I was called on to do this! I did not know what would come! I did not know what a filthy creature Irenicus truly was. I did not!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc and Boo are the greatest of warriors, small one! I will crush your foes into little foe-shaped chunky bits! Who dares pick on you? Just point the way!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No foes? I am relieved. I trust those who prey on children no farther than they can be thrown, even if I manage to throw them pretty far, and throw them I shall!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What? Boo is outraged! See his fury! It's small, so look close. Trust me, it's there. What is wrong with your village, small one? How can we heroes help?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc has been inside out and angry before, and it is never a good thing. Sometimes it frightens even Boo.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oh! Minsc has never been crazy, no sir. Being inside out was bad enough! Is there more, little boy?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Then heroes are certainly needed! Heroes like Minsc and Boo and you! Where is your village, small one? Together we will save the day!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Nothing removes fear better than a good sword and a swift kick in the evil! We shall go to your village and do what heroes do, right?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: There is always time to save the day! Don't worry, small one, we will go to your village as soon as I restore you to their senses. That is my job.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Kicking the posterior of evil is never a fool's errand! Hmm is not their usual heroic self today. An evil influence? Or have their thoughts wandered elsewhere?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Since you is out of their mind, I must step up as a hero should. We go to your village as soon as you is better. So swear Minsc and Boo.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Er... Boo wonders what you need a warrior for when you have no foes?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is curious and keeps bringing up the question of when we will travel to the Imnesvale village, and I heartily agree! We are heroes, and they are in need of heroes-it is a match even Minsc can see!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We must go where evil is in most need of a beating, so Minsc will leave that decision up to you. Still... we must not disappoint the little boy.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Did Minsc miss something? Did we already go and save the Imnesvale village? Boo demands that it is not so, but I cannot remember. Surely we would not shirk out heroic duty for so long! It cannot be!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We come because the little boy, Delon, said that there was evil here in need of a butt-kicking! And good for us that we have our boots on, yes, sir!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No, we can't leave this place without having destroyed all evil! Tell Boo this is not so! Do not destroy a young hamster's innocence!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Wolves? Ogres? Witches? Oh my! It is too much for Minsc's poor head to comprehend! Which of these are evil? The edge of my sword shall find the truth!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oh, most glorious day! One step closer we come to being true heroes, yes indeedy! Even little Boo's fur stands on end from his anticipation!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc agrees! It would be the essence of epic heroing! Dead dragons should litter our path wherever we go!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: (Minsc is charmed by the dryads and will not speak to you. You shall have to agree to help them if you want Minsc back.)

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Enough, Boo tires of this debate. It is old and stale and pointless.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Bah, omens are for those that pay attention to their surroundings, not for such as we, right, Boo?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Anyway, go out of city that way... Keep on the road, turn right at big church, and you will be out.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says not to blame myself, but Boo is a hamster and not as concerned with honor.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Actually, this changes very little. Minsc is happy.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: And perhaps my Boo as well...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: And a good sword...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ooh! And the occasional buffing, for the armor, you understand.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I no more want the trip than you do, so I will not force and I will not leave, but I cannot rest easy until we go.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: If you wish, Dermin, you may return whence you came with the message that "Jaheira the Harper" is dead.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Perhaps we will meet again, but I shall not look forward to it!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Minsc and Jaheira are just northeast of us, trapped in cells sorta like yours. We should free them and then find some gear.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No, this cannot be! The murderer of Dynaheir flees from righteous butt-kicking vengeance! And he takes Imoen with him too!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Something must be done! We must find this evil wizard! All that is goodness cries out for this! Even little Boo, although he cannot cry out quite so loudly.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I find it odd that this Irenicus would leave of his own volition. And why take Imoen when it is you he is so obviously interested in? Perhaps he expects us to give chase?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We must step carefully then. We know little about him... whom he was fighting, who took him, or even where we are. We seem to be drawn into machinations not of our own making.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! We must go quickly and save our friend Imoen! The wizard may be leering over her evilly even now!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do not be foolish, Minsc. We must know our enemies... and the extent of our danger here... before we rush into anything.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I would have expected better from you! You have let yourself fall too far... and I will accompany you no further. We will not meet again.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: So. Your darker desires win over you fully. I have seen enough. Should we meet again, it shall be as opponents and naught else.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Eh? Where have you brought us, Boo? I am duly impressed by your show of great powers, but a little forewarning would have been nice. No matter! Wherever evil treads, Minsc treads louder!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ooo! Look who you have found, Boo, with your unerring sense of hamster direction! It is our good friend! A reunion of heroes! May all that is evil quiver before us like so much rancid jelly, ha!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo's nose twitches at your derision. See? Look at him twitch! If you are not careful, Boo will take us elsewhere to fight evil. I cannot control him when he gets like this!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is healthy and eager to resume the battle! It is why he has brought me here, no doubt. To team up with you again and send evil men scampering all weasel-like into what holes they can find!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Why would I be surprised? Boo points, and I follow! Boo is the navigator, and I am the ship! Boo is the sword arm, and I am the sword! Well, I have a mighty sword arm too, but you get the picture.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Very well. Boo and I will scour the area for evil. It cannot hide from us! Do you hear that, evil? We are coming for you!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc and Boo stand at the ready! Yeah!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Good, good! Boo thought he was smelling nuts earlier. It is something that bears further investigation.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Is this the end of our heroic tale? I would be sad at such goodbyes, but Boo says I should not be such a great smelly baby.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It shall be as you say! We shall wait for another reunion, Boo and I.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Aha! Our good friend returns! Minsc and Boo are ready to take the boot to the black butt of evil!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This must be a place of great importance, then. We shall guard it with our lives!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! Oh, say it is not so! We will no longer fight evil together? Oh... Boo will miss you. Forever shall we hang our heads in sadness in remembrance of our great butt-kicking friend.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo and I will say we knew the hero you. And people will of course not believe us. And maybe, they will look at us more strangely than they do now. Or maybe not.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: *gasp* Such a thing would be a nightmare indeed-why, Minsc could not even fit into your tiny clothes! I have no wish to walk naked through these strange lands...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What is this? The puny gnome speaks with the wrath and rage of a Rashemaar warrior! Boo, I am confused...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Can this be true? Am I but the sneaky little Jan inside Minsc's great, big body?...No! This is not right! Minsc is not Jan... Minsc is Minsc! Minsc is Minsc, Boo is Boo, and you are a naughty, naughty gnome!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Your trick may have worked, tiny one, had Boo not saved me from my confusion. Boo thinks, therefore I am. Remember that before you tempt my wrath by trying to steal my hamster again!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Korgaaan... Korgan, Korgan! Boo tells me that you have been staring at him. I fear your gaze is making him quite angry... you see how his tiny body trembles with the fury?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc knows you are just joking. If Boo was in your belly, he might forget the "miniature" part of his giant space hamster size. Ho ho! That would be a messy end to your jests!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Keldorn, yet again Boo and I are in awe with how deeply you plant the bootprint of justice on the villainous buttocks we encounter so often! Heh!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: And hamsters! Let us not forget Boo and his furry fury.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo? Boo? Where are you?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: The tiny, tricky gnome! Minsc knows it was you who stole Boo! You cannot fool Minsc! What is that bulge moving about within your trousers?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I hear Boo's frenzied squeaking! Ho-ho! He is growing angry, little man. Release Boo from your drawers lest his sharp teeth nibble on your naughty bits in his outrage!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ah, Minsc and Boo together again! Jan, you are not worthy of having a miniaturized giant space hamster scampering loose in your pants.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This is because Rashemen is a very far ways away. Once, Boo kept track for me of the number of steps I have taken since beginning my dajemma, but *sigh* Boo has since forgotten.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo claims that the number is very large. Larger, maybe, than the number of butts that Minsc has deservedly kicked along the way. I find this hard to believe, even though Boo is usually very reliable in these matters.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It is a wonderful place with many fields. It could only be better, maybe, if every ranger of the Berserker Lodge had his very own hamster. Just think of the implications!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes, Dynaheir was a good Rashemaar witch. But I am not so certain that the witches have need of their own hamsters. Dynaheir never approved of Boo... she used to glare at Boo so, it frightened him sometimes.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Rodent? What do you imply about my hamster?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Aerie! Boo has been mulling over a question for you. Never have I seen a hamster concentrate so! He has been so very quiet I thought perhaps I rolled over on him last night, which caused me great concern.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: But Boo's question is of such a personal nature... well, the thought of it makes me blush right down to my buttocks.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You are very insightful! Such bottling could lead to all sorts of un-hamster-like explosions! Well... Boo wonders why you do not perform all your duties, since you are our witch?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Well... a Rashemani witch accompanies a ranger on his dajemma and teaches him the lore of herbs, among other things. Well... Minsc and Boo have discovered a need of some of this lore, maybe.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: After frolicking in a bush that we now consider to be of suspicious nature, both Boo and I have contracted the Calishite itch in rather... private places. A salve would be most joyously anticipated!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Many thanks, Aerie! Soon, maybe, Boo can return his little mind to thoughts of butt-kicking instead of butt-itching, and I for one shall be very relieved!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: So, Anomen, Boo and I had a question about the lodge you seem to hold above all else.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes, that is the one. You view it with as much respect as I give the Ice Dragon Berserker Lodge of my homeland. If they are similar in their intent, we might seek to join.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo understands the tone of your rejection, though he is confused as to why organizations of good intent must always ride atop the *ahem* pole of righteousness.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What, what? Well, an admirable decision, but Boo is not for sale.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: OH! Well then, by all means! And yes, very little requirements. Food, shelter, and perhaps the little wheel. I have heard nothing but good things about the little wheel.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Of course. Boo is special among his kind, and quite resilient. Have I mentioned he is a miniature giant space hamster? I'm sure I have.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Haer'Dalis, are you laughing at Boo and I? You are smiling after many of our battles.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Uh... but mostly evil, right?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo, I think this bard is a little off in the head, no?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo and I always are having time to speak with our friends. Yes, no, Boo?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: And now you would like a hamster.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Just a guess.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: As you wish, but I couldn't imagine a Minsc without a Boo. We are two peas in a pool, two fists in a face, two feet on the floor, and too much for most villainy.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Eh... Boo, was that a compliment?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo? He is young by the standards of his miniature giant cohorts.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I believe he takes offense to the term "rodent."

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You know, try as he might, Boo just doesn't get your kind of humor.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Eh, you know, with all that has been going on, Boo and I are having some trouble keeping our feet on the ground.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You will see no slacking in the sword arm of Minsc, but no matter the running start, I cannot cut through the heavens.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Well, with all this talk of gods, where will Minsc and Boo fit in? Swords have little effect on the heavens.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oh, I am not confused. Clarity is ever my stalwart companion, but where do Minsc and Boo fit when we are battling gods?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Nothing that *stands* can withstand it, but floaty specters of evil gods incarnate may as well be made of the hot air they spew.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: As motivational speeches go, that was not one of your best. Look, Boo shrivels with insecurity. I mean, he's a hamster; just how small do you think he can safely get?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Well, I *believe* that I can stick a thumb in the eye of evil no matter what head it is moored to. Perhaps that is enough. We shall have to see.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: So, "Sarevok," if that is your real name, what do you remember of our previous battles, hmm?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I am not completely convinced that you are who you say you are, standing there saying you are.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo agrees. You are welcome beside us if you effectively apply the boots of goodness.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: A fine choice of mentor, but again, you do not seem like a "Sarevok" to me. Too much "humble," not enough "RAAAAGH, feel my unholy rage."

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is an uncanny judge of character, but you... you give him trouble.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Food storage aside, Boo controls himself far better than you do. Do you see him ranting about mere glances? Let's look.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: There, you see? No rant. In fact, right now we see him snuffing about for a comfy place to sleep. Admirable restraint.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ah, finally a calming look across your face. Boo's handiwork, no doubt. Doesn't that feel better?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Congratulations. Soon, this tiny one will be planting his wee feet into the backside of evil, just like his daddy! We should give him a tiny sword to wave at the villains as we battle! Oh... Boo says that may not be such a good idea.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Look, Boo-everyone knows you now! See how their fame spreads like a scented cloud from your furry backside when you have had one too many crackers!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The natural order will scream in protest should this demon prince be allowed to walk freely through the realms. To preserve the balance, we must imprison the creature-or send it back to the Abyss.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Too much talk, not enough fight!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Too much talk, not enough fight!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I suspect this apparition's sense of duty is going to make our task more difficult.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: As I feared... we must prove our worth to this spirit before we can complete this quest.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Eh? He is like bad penny, this one. An armored, deep-voiced penny of most sinister evil!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That is unworthy of you, Haer'Dalis. The lives of men hang in the balance.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Interesting. A god was forced to deal with your Imprisoned One? No ordinary apparition, this.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We have been betrayed after all! Even Boo cannot believe this. Look at his tiny head shaking in disbelief. Or maybe he is cold. No... definitely disbelief!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We have been betrayed after all! Even Boo cannot believe this. Look at his tiny head shaking in disbelief. Or maybe he is cold. No... definitely disbelief!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You may feel pity for yourself and justify your failure however you wish, Odren, but you attempted to murder us. I am surprised Helm does not turn away from you for such an affront.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: So he wants to play a game? Minsc and Boo are fond of all sorts of games, although Boo is far better at the ones that need strategy. I am sad to say that I am far better at straightforward butt-kicking.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: So he wants to play a game? Minsc and Boo are fond of all sorts of games, although Boo is far better at the ones that need strategy. I am sad to say that I am far better at straightforward butt-kicking.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I don't understand. The witch has her heart back... why is she not nicer to us? What? Oh... yes, I see. Uh-huh. Thank you, Boo. Boo is so smart.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Be not sad, pretty waitress... you will make them stop. Or else Minsc and Boo will deliver an order of booted butt-stomping to the table of mean, ugly men!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oh, Boo, he is going to mention you in his book! Isn't he a nice man?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Poor Mateo. He is alone in the world, as Minsc was before Boo found him. Yes, Boo-you are right! As heroes, we must befriend the friendless. We must help the helpless. We must deaccuse the accused. Er... well, you get the idea.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No... the lady must not die! You are a bad person! All who are true heroes of virtue join me in defending this woman against the naughty bad you!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo does not trust this Kiser. See how his nose twitches? Something smells about this, and it is not stinky clouds from Boo's furry backside.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Mighty heroes like Minsc and you cannot prove themselves against such unworthy opponents... maybe Boo should tackle them alone. Minsc is joking, of course. Let the kobold butt-kicking begin!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: He's not that ugly. Boo's seen much uglier half-orcs. Haven't you, Boo?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You can't work with such as this. Have you forgotten all that Gorion taught you?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Are you calling Boo a fool?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I'm with the hamster.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Take a moment and think. What would Gorion say about this pointless bloodshed?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says it's rude to diminish a bride's radiance on her wedding day.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Careful. We want to walk into the gorge, not fall into it.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What do you think, Boo? Isn't this a nice tree?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo doesn't think this is a nice tree.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I think Boo is right.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Beware. You cannot trust a tanar'ri.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Speak for yourself! Boo is the warm center of the universe that I orbit during my slumber each night!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Trusts?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo dislikes this place. These people are trapped in a wheel that turns and turns, but never moves forward.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo dislikes this place. These people are trapped in a wheel that turns and turns, but never moves forward.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It's all right, Boo. They're dead, but I'm sure they're not bad-

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You were right, Boo. They weren't nice at all.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: An evil one.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says smoking isn't healthy.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Mad angry, not mad crazy.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: For justice!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What's that, Boo? You need to speak up; I can't hear you over the incredibly loud rumbling.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We must proceed with caution. The Red Wizards are devious. They will expect retaliation.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Animals should be wild, not kept as pets by wandering heroes. Tell Barad the gift is appreciated but inappropriate.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc is torn! It seems only fair that you be able to walk with a small animal to advise them, too. But Minsc also fears for Boo... Dings might have a bad attitude toward hamsters.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The half-elf's magic may represent a threat to the balance, but I think she would do less harm with us than without us.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Let me guess! You admire Boo from afar. You have thought to yourself, "Boo strong! Boo handsome!"

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Do not hold back! Out with it! Boo can take it!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ah, yes! You are afraid Boo has become too mighty. You see how he looks into a demon's eyes and how the demon fears to meet his gaze!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You imagine him finding a hole in dragon's armor and showing Minsc where to point his sword!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You think Boo will find sacred cup, pull sword from rock, destroy cursed ring, win golden branch, and kill big evil!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Die? Ha! Where Minsc goes, Boo follows, and where Boo goes, so does Minsc! Death has no sting for us!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No. Nooo! You, Neera! You did this!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Your last spell. Your last spell did this to my Boo!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ah, Boo! Your fur was like gold, like topaz, like dark honey from the meadows of Rashemen. And now…

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Pink! All pink.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: A HAMSTER IS NOT A FLOWER.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! No more spells! Boo and I will stand over here. Way over here!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Neera? Boo and I would like to say sorry.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says he didn't mind being pink. It was nice change. I kind of liked it too.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc is a berserker. Minsc understands.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: A little messy, but easier to fix!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo and Minsc wish you found a good name! But Minsc and Boo are also not sorry you've stopped looking.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Ha. My advice has the virtue of being in the common tongue, at least. And I can take the shape of a bear when I please.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Refusing to engage with him further was wise. I sense that he is a part of the magic that infects this forest.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: They do have nice voices, don't they, Boo?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says we should find the hairband! Boo believes the children are our future!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Don't worry, Boo. No one will leave you behind.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo knew where the Pavilion of Righteous Wrath was the whole time. The space hamster is no stranger to Lunia.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You will need an advisor, heir to the throne! It is Minsc's opinion that hamsters make the best advisors.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You disappoint me more than I could ever say. I am glad Gorion is not around to see this.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I'm sorry. I thought you were talking to Boo.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I am.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No, no! It was my dajemma that brought me here. That and-my witch.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I failed the dajemma. I failed my witch. I failed myself.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo understands. Boo forgives, even if I cannot.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo thinks you are a good man. You should come to Rashemen with us when I return there. We could parade around Immilmar-I'd introduce you as my long-lost brother. Hah! Wouldn't that be something?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Are you sure...? She's-well, you know.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: She SEEMS nice, yes, but still-vampire.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No, they aren't.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I was talking to Boo.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says you aren't what you seem.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You... RECOGNIZE giant space hamsters?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is right. You aren't a normal vampire.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Maybe it's all right that you're with us after all.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Well. You're a vampire.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo thinks... you're all right.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! Never!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes. I'll do that.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says he doesn't fully trust you, half-orc.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Giant space hamsters aren't easy to fool.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You will? Good. That's good.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says-

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: do you think it wise to spend so much time with Dorn? He seems to have taken an unhealthy interest in you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He is not to be trusted.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He is a murderous half-orc with an unquenchable bloodlust. He is incapable of the feelings you and I possess.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: If you intend to take up with a barbaric half-orc, I must end this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am relieved to hear that.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am glad Gorion did not live to see this.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Friend Rasaad, I have a question, and Boo is being most uncooperative. What is a honeymoon?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: So there are no bees?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I shall take your word for it. Boo's answer involved both bees and birds. It was... confusing.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ahh, Dorn. Even you must sense the cheer in the air!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc and Boo would like to see you try! We would whistle all the while as we stamped your bones to dust!
